text: 341ml bottle (thx, Alex M.!). Bottled on 2015-09-25 (lost in inventory, hehe). Three varieties of Dernière Volonté in a row. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is fruity, flowery, typical for Belgian beers. Same taste, similar to Belgian Saisons. Good stuff, despite its old.
Ma premiere Dieu du Ciel. Très bon depart. Content de faire connaissance avec une micro de très haute qualité.

Bottle; pours hazy orange gold with a white head; aroma of malt, citrus fruits, yeast, and some spice and floral notes; taste is citrus fruits, malt, and some bready notes; finish is dry with some spice

355mL Bottle (2016-09-16): Poured hazy orange, very faint white head, small bits of sediment. Aroma of wheat, bread, floral hop, pepper spice, orange peel, hint of bubblegum and an interesting funkiness from the blend of hops/yeast that I just cant put my finger on. Light sweetness, light bitterness (I didnt get much of the bitter hop taste), medium body, tingly carbonation, oily dry finish. Overall: definitely interesting, good taste and finish. The scent was initially not for me but I warmed up to it.

On tap at DDC St-Jerome. Lets be honest. This beer used to be among the best and an incredible one. Few years ago, DDC had issues with the procurement of the yeast and it had never been the same when they reintroduced it with apparently a new recipe to accommodate a different yeast. I even had the impression they may have changed the recipe more than once in trying to achieve something satisfying. The beer is still good, but no longer the exceptional one it used to be few years ago!

bottle @ Keg Liquors / Clarksville IN --- Aroma of malt and bitter floral. Cloudy medium / dark amber, off-white head that sinks quickly to a cover, mottled curtain of lace. Taste is Semi-sweet caramel malt that adds solid carbonation on the swallow before revealing yeast and mild floral hops that drift through a long finish. Big and bold, but still light in the belly. Solid brew.

Bottle shared at the Weekend in the woods 2015 with daje, Simonsen and some other guys
Orange hazy, big frothy head. Smell of yeast esters, spices, smelly feet and "gymbag", light malts, some funky brett. Light to moderate sweet, fruity, some funk and complexity, quite dry. Medium bitter, herbal tail. Quite nice!

Shared 11.5 oz. bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a large foamy white head. Aroma is malty with floral elements. Taste is fruit, spice, malt, caramel, yeast, herbs and alcohol. Definitely unique. Not bad.

Aroma: malty and floral at the same time; Appearance: straw, hazy with very full head that dissipates slowly; particulate suspended Taste: unusual; definitely spicy and hoppy and fruity; pretty refreshing; more like a saison than a beligan ale; Palate: medium body with long, slightly odd tasting finish; Overall: very interesting and unusual belgian. Not quite my thing but I can appreciate it.
Bottle thanks to oldp0rt! Pours hazy orange with a finger of head. Nice fruity orange, citrus, slighty breadyness, light spice, yeast, sourdough, medium bitterness, light tropical, mango, dry. Tasty!

BOD 3/15. Medium amber murky pour with suspended particulate matter from bottle conditioning. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

Rich world class nose of fruity esters coupled with a light tart airiness. Peach, plum, pineapple, grape and orange coupled with a touch of pepper over a light Belgian base.

Light medium body with a smooth texture. World class carbonation with a nice effervescent middle and a finely bubbled prickly finish perfectly paired with the body.

The flavor profile is almost world class, but falls just a bit short due to a very light metallic note which arrives and lingers in the finish. Otherwise, this one is a very tasty Belgian ale with a world class fruity ester profile. Flavors from the nose all appear with some separation. The sweeter flavors appear after the middle corresponding with maximum balanced sweetness. The middle provides a very light rind bitterness. The finish is a slow fade of fruit and the light metallic note.

Dark yellow pour, touch of orange. Aroma is yeast, but too much, touch of citrus. Taste is musty, smoke, almost wheaty. ...creamy feel. 
Not as good as the flying fish grand xru which I am trying side by side.

Aroma - some floral attributes, as well as white flesh fruit, and Brettanomyce yeast. There is some spices as well.
Appearance - body jonquil yellow, with some very fine particles, and some nucleation; the head is white and about 12" and settles into a small foam. Some lacing.
Taste - is lightly sweet and a faint bit tart. There is a floral quality, some coriander spice, there is some very light fruit. The yeast is Belgian (Brettanomyce).
Palate - light body, lively carbonation, and dry
12oz bottle pours a hazy yellow Amber color with a bit of frothy head. Yeast flavors overpower a little though I did end up with the dregs in my glass.

341ml Bottle from 4 pack of all variant bought at Marché Village. Aroma: nice citrus, Belgian yeast giving some green apples, spices including some cloves. App: cloudy golden with a good orange tint, small white head, shy bubbly lacing. Taste and palate: full body, soft carbonation, clean light bitter finish. Overall: not sure why I never rated this one. Anyway this is well made. A typical Belgian style. Really easy to drink.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour. Yeasty, fruity, spicy aroma and flavour. Medium body, enjoyable beeer

341ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, golden colour with small to average, thick, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Sweet-ish, floral, fruity and slightly spicy aroma, hints of apple purée and speculoos. Taste is caramel malty, minimally floral, slightly spicy and fruity hoppy overtones, apple purée and speculoos again, a peppery touch; lasting bitter hoppy finish.

Bottle at home from brewdog online, 1yr oldfruity bubble gum esters, boozy notes, sweet, achouffe like. Hazy pale burnished blonde with fluffy offwhite head collapsing to lacing. Super carbonated fruity, yeast esters, warming, spicey, v Belgian.

Poured a good size foamy white head, with sediments clearly visible. Fairly hazy appearance. Strong cirtus/hops aromas. Great citrus flavours, with lemons, oranges, and others coming through. Also a bit yeasty, very tasty and smooth. Pretty good tangy mouthfeel. This one is clearly not an obvious strong beer, even with the 7% abv. Itss not quite apparent at first, great easy drinking beer. Last Will? Pretty darn close!

Pours a pale amber body with a medium head. Very nice aroma with tones och fresh fruit. Nice and fresh taste with hoppy tones and a bitter end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From old notes. From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Golden color with white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, spicy, floral and fruity. Sweet and light bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Nez: Banane, levure
Bouche: Pêche, citron, épicée, herbe grasse, légèrement résineuse
Bière bien ronde dans laquelle on reconnait la levure Belge.
Belle longueur en bouche tout en finesse de lamertume.
One of the tastiest Belgian ales, with enough hop influence to cut away the normal sweetness. Very drinkable .

Bottle. Pours a bit hazy golden, medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma is grassy, floral, honey. Flavor is light sweet, and light bitter, floral, grassy, a bit of pepper, cereal grains, perhaps grains of paradise going on. Medium body, interesting for sure.

Not my cup of tea. Belgium IPA, no mas. This is one hybrid that did not mix. Boring. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with large colapsing frothy white head. Aroma of sweet spices, peaches and a bit of bread. Taste is more of the same with a citrusy hop aspect in the forefront. Light to medium body. Dry finish.

Damn this beer was tasty. Golden color with a big frothy white head. Smells of earthy spices, peaches and grass. Flavors are more of the same along with some nice hoppy citrus presence. Feels like a saison mixed with an IPA. Perfect mouthfeel; substantial but still light enough to be an easy drinker and medium carbonation. Good mix of tartness, sweetness and bitterness.

App: Golden yellow with a slight haziness, light soapy head that dies down to a thin film that stick around for a while. Its a pretty presentation, typical of a belgian ale.

Nose: Clove, pepper, a bit of banana, peach, apricot, white grapes, papaya, white bread very tropical and complex with a slight acidic edge reminiscent of a white wine with some added horse blanket, wet towel, barnyard funky notes that elevates this beer adding even more depth.

Taste: the grapefruit and citrus notes typical of an ipa are more present while still getting those yellow stone fruits and tropical notes. The spicy notes like pepper and clove arent hard to find aswell as that nice funkyness. The bitterness is pleasent. A bit of dankness, pine and grassyness in a dry finish.

This is a masterpiece of a beer with an unusual hop profile full of depth and complexity.
It is highly drinkable. Its the type of beer that you have a hard time putting down.
The malt are suddle in the background, leaving the floor for the hop and the yeast to shine in the spotlight. Very fresh, fruity and spicy while remaining very satisfying and complex. I cant believe i took so long before getting this one. Will buy again, highly recommanded. 

(French)

Apparence: Jaune dorée vibrant. Moyennement voilé, avec mousse savonneuse qui se dissipe en un mince film qui demeure présent. Une belle biere sexy and classy.

Nez: Le clous, le poivre et un peu de banane. Les fruits sont a lhonneur avec des notes de pèche, abricots, raisin blanc, de papaye et de mis de pain blanc. Une certaine acidité et des notes funky de ferme, de couverture de cheval mouillée qui vient ajouté un agréable niveau de complexité.

En bouche: Les notes classique dagrumes tels que le pamplemousse, le citron et lorange sont plus présente toujours avec des notes de fruits jaunes a noyau qui la diffère de la plupart des IPA. Le clou et le poivre, ainsi que les notes funky sont présentes en bouche également. Une finale avec une amertume moyenne, herbacé avec un peu de sapinage résineux et une touche de "dankness". Quelle belle profondeur. Cest difficile de poser son verre.

Arômes de houblons floraux, orange, pamplemousse et épices. En bouche, une belle présence de saveurs fruitée. Orange, pamplemousse et banane se côtoient à merveille et équilibre parfait avec les houblons qui apportent une touche amère bien douce et épicée. Amerume fruitée où le pamplemousse se démarque. Le haut taux dalcool ne parait aucunement. Autre bijou de DDC. Une bière à apprécier bien froide pour bien apprécier son côté rafraichissant et fruité.

Embouteillée en octobre 2014 et dégustée en février 2015. Cette bière est un très joli clin doeil à la Belgique en présentant des arômes de levures, de houblons frais et de poivre. Cest épicé tout en étant très léger et équilibré. On se croirait vraiment en Belgique si ça navait été de lépaisse mousse qui saffaisse très rapidement en un mince filme de surface. En bouche leffervescence est justement dosée et on ne sent absolument pas les 7% dalcool présents dans cette bière. Le tout est rond, soyeux et les saveurs sont houblonnées sans toutefois être tranchantes et agressives. Cette bière est très délicate et harmonieuse. Très jolie bière dont la finale trop subtile est le seul défaut.

Pours cloudy golden yellow with big fluffy white head that reduces steadily. Nice but conflicting aromas of flowers, biscuits, pine, malt.
In the glass, theres more of the same: a bit of flowers, a bit of yeast, a bit of malt, a bit too much hops. Rather than complex, though, it just seems undecided on a style.

12oz bottle poured at home, from west lakeview liquors. Super cloudy yellowish with white fluffy head. Has a fruity dirty diaper aroma. Lemon and citrus flavor, spices, tastes more like a saison to me than a Belgian ipa. good though

Golden yellow with a cream-colored head, medium-fine, frothy, that fades a ta moderate-fast rate to a film/ring. Aroma is dry scone, lemon, grapefruit, some barnyard wet hay, granary, floral notes. Body is medium-to-medium-light, syrupy-watery with a moderate-to-heavy carbonation and commensurate burn. Flavor is raw sugar, sap, some grass and barnyard, crisp and light bitterness with touch of dry grain in the finish. A very nice Belgian ale. Particularly excellent is the meld of hop aroma/flavor with saison-like yeast and dry malt character. No flaws in this one.

Complex aroma of a balance between malt, hops and yeast, flowers, and pine gum. Beautiful appearance! Massive everlasting, rocky head of white foam and excellent l lacing. Slightly hazy bottle conditioned medium Amber colour. Superb complex flavour, again a beautiful balance of hops and yeast.
Very nice indeed. Bottled in October 2014. Cheers!
IPA pas mal, mais manque cruellement de caractère. Pas mauvaise, mais une seule expérience.
Tap, Brewdog, Sheffield. Hazy gold. Ginger and tar aroma. Thick, balanced with a long citrus nectarine finish.

Tap at Brewdog Shorditch. Poured a hazy medium amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is caramel resin hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a rich woody resin citrus hop palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Draft. Hazy golden pour, tall white dense head, lots of sticky foamy lacing. Bready, citrus, tropical fruit, aroma, floral but not overwhelming. Taste is much the same, but theres a real good hop presence there too.

341ml bottle (dated July 2012) served around 6 degrees in a snifter:

This beer was recommendation made by a beer fanatic friend of mine and I thought Id give it a try to see if it was as impressive as she described it. Honestly, it was. Being a huge fan of Dieu du Ciel, I did have some expectations and as usual they met every single one of them. Lets begin:

Visually, the beer pours an hazy golden releasing a fair amount of micro carbonation. I got about three fingers of fluffy foam with awesome retention properties as you can appreciate on the picture I took moments after pouring it.

The nose is an interesting blend of flowers, honey, citrus and bready malts. The brew is very aromatic, but I didnt find it to be aggressive or excessively floral. The malts brought everything to an enjoyable equilibrium.

On the tongue, youre first hit with the citrus and the floral elements. Some honey paves the way to the finale and enhances the flavours to give a floral finish holding a moderate bitterness. I have to mention the brews exceptionnal density and silky/oily feel.

Overall a very nice product even for those unaquainted with the IPA. Its good without being too complex or too bold. A perfect match with zesty salads, strong cheeses (an old cheddar for instance) or your favorite spicy food. Cheers!
(bottle) hazy copper colour with a tall tan head; aroma of tropical fruit, flowers; balanced flavour with a long, slowly building medium bitter finish; excellent Belgian ipa
Bottle. It was a bit old, but is was still nice enough. Would like to try a fresher batch though.
Bottle shared at a tasting at Stas place. Murky greenish blond with white head. Very yeasty aroma - end of bottle sample. sweetish and rich taste. Medium body, smooth, fruity aftertaste.
Bottle at Anton's in Toronto. Hazy light orange golden pour. Belgian-y aroma with slightly more hoppiness - citrus peel. Taste is the same. More Belgian, less IPA. Not bad.

Poured a hazy light gold with a fizzy white head. Aromas of white wine, apples, Belgian yeast, along with some floral notes. Has a smooth medium body and medium carbonation. Has that familiar sweet spiced flavor from the Belgian yeast and a nice amount of hoppy bitterness. I find there are some floral almost tea-like qualities. Im a sucker for Belgian inspired beers, and this one fits the bill. One of my favorite breweries.
Très forte présence de levure et dalcool au nez. On goûte bien les fruits et les fleurs. Personnellement, je préfère celle vieillie en fût mais cest une bonne belge...

Tangy-sweet aroma, biotic, reminds me of duck sauce. Muddy tan. Okay label, twist off longneck. Mature flavor. Stewed citrus, mineral, lightly sweet, muted vinegar. Contemplative mouthfeel. Greenish hops on the back end. Interesting, good. Proof Bottle Shop.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Vova. Pours yellow with a nice head, aroma of yeast, flowers, spices, flavor is yeasty, spices, wheat, some bitterness, medium bodied
Color dorado ligeramente turbio, espuma blanca. Aromas de fruta verde, levadura y lupulo floral. Cuerpo medio bajo, inicio afrutado, ligeramente dulce, y final seco. Buena.
Tap at Biercab. Orange apricot taste, light fruity sweetness. Full body, very light bitter aftertaste. Good beer.
Nice mix of Belgian-style yeast/wheat flavors and fruity peach/apricot dry-hopping, touch of honey, dry peppery finish. A well-done Belgian IPA with a smooth fruit cake character.
341ml bottle from pistáchio, Portugal. Cloudy apperance. Thin persistent head. Medium bitterness. Aroma is herby, hoppy, citric. Lovely.

Aromes de sucre,pêche,poire,pain petit gâteaux,bien effervescente avec une mousse qui ce tien solide. aspect citronné,herbeux un petit peut.sinon très rafraîchissante , bonne amertume , facilité déconcertante à boire cette bière!,arôme de mangue toute le long...
Bottle (saveur bier). Golden hazy. Nice sharp citrus, belgy yeast, pale malts on nose. Bitter mouthfeel, bit dry. Soft though, enjoyable. Pretty long fruity hoppy finish. Real nice.-- bb
From a 12 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a clear gold with a thick off white head. Feint aroma of Belgian yeast. Flavors of tropical fruits with strong floral notes. Smooth, clean finish.

Draught at BrewDog Shepherds Bush on 14 Oct. Poured a cloudy orange, with a dense white head. Aroma of soft fruit, yeast esters and pineapple. Some citrus hop notes in the flavour with apricot sweetness and a bready backbone. Finish was sharp peal, pine and chalk.
On tap at Biercab. Orange colour with white head. Citric and malty aroma. Sweet, fruity, citric and malty taste. Medium body.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 341ml bottle served in a tulip glass.
Reviewing it while bottling my 4th home-made IPA :)
A: Beautiful bottle art, Dieu du Ciel trademark. Pours a hazy bright orange color forming a creamy and compact beige head. Great retention and lots of lingering and molasses lacings left in the glass
S: Absolutely belgian IPA in the nose :). Sweet malts, candy sugar, spices, flowery hops and earthy yeasts. Notes of honey, dark fruits, cinnamon and cloves. Hops are quite citruses. Very pleasant, though 
T: Follow the nose. Sweet, fruity and spicy upfront. Notes of candy sugar, caramel malts, cinnamon, cloves, honey, earthy yeasts, peaches, white bread. Complex. Delicious. Finish is slightly hoppy bitter
M: Creamy molasses body. Medium carbonation. Sweet and spicy aftertaste
O: Very drinkable. Its not at all a Belgian IPA but a Belgian Strong Ale. Great beer which is no surprise considering the brewery
[ BA Review @ 4/6/2013 ]

Pours a medium orange color with a nice frothy white head. Aroma is light hops, belgian yeast, bananas, fruit. The taste is lemons, bananas, tasty earthy flavored hops, and belgian candy sugar. Unfortunately theres a bitter metallic aftertaste after every sip that destroys the taste. I like it but I hate the aftertaste.
Keg @ Brewdog, Birmingham. Pours hazy orange with floral aroma. Spicy Belgian yeast esters in the taste, floral hops with some vanilla and light fruitiness. Very nice indeed.

Draft at BD ShepBush. Hazy gold, receding head. Rich toffee and vanilla, apple blossom, light spice ester nose. Rich sweet fudge, custard, light floral, moderate bitterness, more apple and some light citrus. Nice enough but Id like more hop character for a Belgo IPA.

Couleur jaune dorée, légère mousse blanche. Nez houblonné un peu fruité. Gout houblonné une peu fruité, corps un peu petillant aspirine, amertume en fin de bouche, assez seche. Pas une IPA, pas une super belge, en dessous des Dieu du ciel habituelles.

Keg at BD Camden, 30/09/14.
Very lightly hazed golden blonde with a moderate off white covering that dissipates then retains.
Nose is Belgian yeast esters, clove, vanilla, light nana, grain, spice, bready notes.
Taste comprises mellow fruit notes, vanilla, yeast esters, caramel, grain.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Adequate Belgian affair, not a huge amount going on.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: SWBF 2014. Pours a cloudy orange with a low white head. Aromas of orange, mango, grapefruit and honey. Taste is mango and grapefruit with some orange and honey notes. Mouthfeel is slightly oily and smooth with medium carbonation.

Aroma is slightly hoppy florals at first that are immediately overcome by the typical belgian fruity essence.

Pour is pale straw with a thick, foamy head that lingers well. At once bitter and sweet with medium body and pleasantly balanced carbonation. Lots of Belgian flair in the middle palate which yields interestingly to the dry hops on the back end.

Hmm, mouth is dry, better have another taste...
Older bottle (not sure how old) pour slight hazy light gold. Nose slightly tart, floral, Belgian ester. Taste floral hop, mild spice. Mid palate sharp bitter. Light spice and ester on the finish.
Bottle brewdog Sheff. Light copper. Aroma is yeast fruity caramel malts taste same nice bitter finish. Decent stuff
Bottle from brewdog, sheffield. Light amber ale. Aroma of clove. Taste is sweet and bitter. Tingly carb medium/thin body.
"Very floral and spicy aroma. More malt and Belgian yeast in the flavor, though some citrusy hops hang around too. Pretty nicely done. Dry, spicy finish."

When Belgium and IPAs hang out, everyone wins. This lil stinker is no exception. The typical musty, bubblegummed yeasty dank of Belgium mushes into the floral and resin hops backboned by good ol caramel. A hazy straw bomb with a quickly dissipating white head that laces correctly. Bittersweet with hints of lemon, hops and honey, this is a joy to drink. Mid-low carbonation keeps the body smooth as silk. A great marriage of styles.
Bottle. Cloudy orange body with white head. Aroma is fruity yeast with a little bit of sourness. Taste is dried fruit with some spices and some pepper. Aftertaste is medium bitter and dry. Nice one.

Pours a clear amber with light head. Aromas of Belgian yeast; dried bananas, burnt rubber, and a bit of cloves. Flavors of stoned fruit, candy, yeast, toasted malts, and banana/rubber with some floral notes.

Yellow, and cloudy with white foam that lasts. Mild sour earthy apricot. Malt in the first sip, with a strong flavour of apricot. Hint of alcohol. Nice sweet grape fruit bitterness in the aftertaste that grows. High in carbon. From a bottle, a gift from Amy

Mine had a different picture, but I do believe this is correct. Poured a dark hazy straw with a big white creamy head. Aroma was of citrus, floral hops, basement, apples, and yeast. Tasted fruity with light gum, banana, and wheat. Had a chewy medium body with low carbonation. Was a strong bitter tongue coater as well. Very quaffy and quite a stand out among other Belgians.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy, deep brassy gold, medium whitish head with very nice retention and okay lacing. Nose is big grassiness, some burnt caramel, dried oranges, mild yeasty presence. Mouth is medium bodied, semi-sticky, lightly sweet up front and then becomes rather dry and light bitterness throughout. Caramel, orange peel, hints of white pepper and vanilla toward finish. Tasty.

Bottle @ home - Color: clear blond beer with small carbonate and small white foam. Smell : malty and grassy nose with yeasty presence. Taste: really great balance of malt and hops. Nice caramel taste. Aftertaste: good equilibrium of taste. Nice malty taste with good bitterness. Really nice beer, I recommend it! Have to try !

Bottle sample at a tasting, thanks Vova. Hazy orange with a nice creamy head. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Sweet with fruity, yeasty and caramel malts flavors. Medium-bodied, sticky syrupy mouthfeel. Decent.

Apparence: D?une couleur jaune paille opaque, elle est coiffée d?une bonne mousse d?une bonne durée. Effervescence difficile à évaluer, mais semble quasi inexistante. 

Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des arômes de malt et des épices. 

Saveurs: En bouche, cest un corps moyen. Au goût, cest les épices qui attaquent pour être suivit par le malt avant de laisser place à lamertume du houblon. De durée moyenne, il y a une très légère effervescence. 


Fiche technique 
Style: IPA Style Belge
Format: 341 ml
Taux d?alcool : 7%

Bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Vova. Slightly hazy yellow-gold with a white head. Aroma of some citric hops, yeast and mild spiciness. Sweetish flavor with yeast, some fruitiness, some spiciness, citric hops and a bitter finish. Medium-bodied.
Une biere quon croirait belge mais en plus goulayant, vive le Quebec ivre!!!

How : bottle
 Where : les fleurs du malt le bar, Lyon, France
 Appearance : hazy golden with White head
 Aroma : malty, fruity, spicy, clove, citrus
 Body : medium body
 Flavour: fruity, herbal, bitter, citrus

A decent fruity lambic-like Belgian IPA. Pours a deep orange with a thick white head. Smells of spice, citrus and general fruit. Taste starts sweet, continues that way to end in just a bit of sourness and spice. Had on tap at the Stubborn Goat in Halifax.

Draught @ Alibi Room, Vancouver.
Clear gold, with little head or carbonation. Lil banana nose. Complex flavour; malty, herby, yeast and hop bitter finish. Would like it to be a bit less boozy, but its good.

Bière jaune orangée, bien voilée, très effervescente, et surmontée dun col blanc immaculée, moyennement large, mais très dense, très mousseux, qui colle sur les parois du verre, et qui semble éternel. Arômes de pain frais, pâtisserie, malt mielleux, léger sucre dorge, fruits du verger (pêche, poire, pomme) et levure belge. On décèle également certains effluves plus houblonnés en arrière-plan, mais difficile à cerner et à décrire. Ce houblon semble à la fois floral, poivré et herbacé. Beau nez bien agréable, très belle complexité, mais ça manque passablement dintensité cependant. En bouche, pétillement moyen-élevé sur la langue, breuvage bien mousseux, et très belle onctuosité, cest moelleux, soyeux et velouté au palais! Au goût, ça rejoint pas mal le nez avec du pain frais et de la pâtisserie, un léger sucré style miel et/ou sucre dorge, dabondants fruits du verger, et une levure belge discernable. Le houblon est quant à lui heureusement bien plus présent en bouche quau nez, et il est principalement herbacé et poivré avec également quelques accents de conifère. Lamertume est de faible à modérée. Bière heureusement bien plus intense en bouche quau nez, très belle complexité, très belle intégration des différentes saveurs entre elles, et très bel équilibre malt/houblon. Létiquette mentionne quil sagit dune «IPA style belge». Moi, je décrirais cette bière comme une triple bien plus houblonnée que ne le veut la tradition, et le résultat en est excellent!
Golden amber pour, half inch thick foam head. Yeast nose, mild clove. Taste adds grains, flowers, grass in addition to the clove. Body is light, prickly carbonation.

Dieu du Ciel, Montreal tap: Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is yeast and citrus. Taste is bitter and dry, but quite fruity. Plenty of floral aromas and tastes. Kind of spicy as well. Pretty good.

Another excellent brew from Dieu Du Ciel! It is a abbey style blonde ale but it could be categorized in its own style! Blond, foamy, effervescent, dry to the palate. Goes perfect with humus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at The Guild, Victoria. Estery, peppery nose. Fruity taste, medium to high carbonation. Fruity, slightly alcoholic in the finish. Pretty good.
Aroma is fruity and a bit funky. Tastes definitely like a Belgian IPA but not getting a lot of American citrus flavors. Aftertaste is a bit odd.

Pours a dark muddy brown orange pour with a small head. Nose is fruity and sweet. Taste is fruity and spicy, sweet without a bold yeast flavor. Drinkable and full of flavor. Finish is sweet and fruity as well, dry with moderate lingering and some yeast in the finish. Quaff Score 8 / 10
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with a white head and aroma of hops and spices. Taste is of spices, hops, malt, fruits, caramel, and floral notes with a fruity, dry finish
Pours golden. Aroma of honey. Taste of hops, alcohol and honey. Tastes neither Belgian nor like an IPA. Not impressed.

Bottle. Hazy burnt orange, light brown with a lasting 1 finger tight head and serious lacing. Aroma is floral hops and Belgian spiced yeast. The taste adds Belgian caramelized sugar with fruit in the background. Sweet medium palate with a sugary aftertaste. I expected a lighter blonde but, the malt forward body is a pleasant surprise. Great stuff. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly hazy golden-orange color with nice frothy white head. Citrus, banana, and clove notes. Belgian yeast too. Taste is bitter hops with strong Belgian yeast. Nice balance with the fruity flavours (orange, citrus, grapefruit, passion fruit). Great bitter aftertaste. High carbonation. Excellent beer!

Misty orange body and stable large head. Fresh fruity hops, peach, red apple, rosemary and Belgian yeast . Good yet straight taste, light bitter and light sweet. Very well brewed, flawless. (Bottle from Saveur Bière)

Smells fruity, Peachy smell and slightly sweet. Pours golden, cloudy with lots of sediment. White head. 

Tastes like a hoppy saison. Funky, slightly sweet, peppery, coriander, citrus. Very pleasant. 

Medium body, nicely moderately carbonated, nice finish. 

Very tasty brew, doesn't look as good as it could, especially with dark looking sediment. flavour and mouthfeel is great.

2014 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours a hazy golden straw color with a fluffy white head. Aroma is hay and damp soil with lemon and a hint of herbal spice. Pours a hazy light golden with a nice off white head that settles to a film and leaves great lacing. Aroma has Belgian yeast fruitiness with biscuit malt and mild grassy hops. Really flowery aroma, nice, but the flavors are a bit on the bitter side and the finish feels a tad astringent. Not a bad example of the style but not as drinkable as Id like.

First look... I thought it looks amazing, cloudy dark yellow beer, with stable pale yellow head, and lovely mandarin, orange, oak and honey aromas. 341 ml bottle.

34,1 cl bottle (7%) @ home. Batch #62, bottled 01/2013
Aroma is hayish with some apricot and fruitiness typical to Belgian ales. Also alcohol is present. Flavour has grassy hops, apricot. spicy tones and some fruity Belgian yeast. Perhaps also some ash. Nice, I like the spices and grass here.

341ml bottle. Cloudy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are apricot, grapefruit, banana, vanilla, dough, ginger, cloves and wheat with floral notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, creamy texture.
Hazy, blond with white & creamy head. Spicy nose. Medium body. Hops & bitteron palate.
341ml bottle at 7% alc./vol. Pours a pale amber colour with a small white head. Pretty decent classic Belgian style IPA.

341ml bottle from Saveur-Biere

Taste is stingy, earthy and spicy with some Belgian yeastiness, floral hops and grass. Finish is bitter, sweetish and earthy with some tartish fruitness and yeastiness. Un collet de mousse généreux sinstalle à long terme sur une robe orangée assez trouble. Un bouquet très fruité gracieuseté des houblons aromatiques et de la levure qui apporte une bonne dose doranges émane du verre. Bottle. Color orange with big white head. Aroma malt, yeast, hop, coriader, apricot. Taste sweet, yeast, bitterness, spicy, fruits.

Bottled. Pours clear golden with a small, white head. Aroma of fruit, caramel and yeast. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A nice Belgian.
yeasty, citrus-lemon aroma. A little malty, a little spices. Strong, interesting, bold taste. Malt, yeast, bitter citrus. Fruity. some floral. A sweet bitter finish.

Poured s hazy golden orange, with sediment. Small creamy white head, fairly lasting. Fruity aroma. Yeasty, orangey type fruity, caramel, some spices and grains. Lighter medium body. Flavor is also fruity, accompanied by yeasty, some spices, grains, and alcohol. Finish is fairly dry with a some floral bitterness. Interesting. Dont think Ive had something quite like it before. Some sips I dig it, some I dont.

Mi-belge, mi-IPA quon aurait quasiment pû me faire passer pour une blanche aux épices! Couleur jaune orangée intense. Légères effluves de clous de girofle et dépices. Aroma of cloves and banana, taste of spice and bananas, cloudy golden colour, no head with a refreshing finish of spice.

Poured from a bottle. Slight hazy golden color, medium white head. Sweet clove aroma. Light crisp clove flavor with a nice refreshing finish.

Pours murky amber with white head. Well carbonated. Lacing on the glass. Smells of spicy Belgian yeast, honey, somewhat minty. Nice Belgian yeast flavour with a balanced bittersweet finish. Some caramel malt, mint, very refreshing and tasty.

Belgian double IPA. Nice and boozy hoppy beer. It's not a hop bomb and ok to drink- Good to middling.

Bottle, 341mL. Home. A hazy amber beer with a medium white thin head. Low persistence. Nice sweet aroma, candy sugar is in there somewhere. Cloudy golden colour with big head. Sweet but bitter with some candy sugar hit. Med body and carbonation

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes goldenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, malzig süß, leicht würzig. Geschmack leicht hefig, fruchtig malzig, Gewürze, blumig.
Hazy golden pour with white head. Aromas of hay, yeast, coriander, spicy notes. Medium bodied and creamy. Flavours of bready malt, citrus, yeast. Oddly minty. Nice.
Bottle @ Hamnmästaren in Malmö. New bottles which labels it as a "Belgian IPA". Not one of their best but still very decent.
Dorée et voilée. Nez de levures belges et dagrumes. Goût herbacé, sucré, dagrumes et de levures. Douce amertume avec une finale légèrement sèche.

Bottle in Brewdog Nottingham. Pours slightly hazy amber with a brief white head. Starts fruity and sweet. Smooth caramel and banana. A little spice too. A more bitter finish with butter and a touch of pine.

Ambrée avec un col moyen blanc. Larôme du levure belge, les épices (comme du cannelle et clous de girofle), et du fruit. Le goût est du malt, épices, et fruit avec une finale légèrement amer avec une presence solide des épices.

*Beer Review*

Derniere Volonte from Dieu du Ciel

My wife and I visited Dieu du Ciel in Montreal as part of our honeymoon. At the time they served 2 of the top 10 beers in the world.

This was not one of those. Actually never heard of this until I saw it at the LCBO.

Very hazy golden yellow pour with lacy head. Weak scent. Smelly like a beer. A hoppy beer but a beer. Holy fruity. Tastes nothing like the usual puckery grapefruit like bitterness of most pale ales. 

Seriously wow. This is fantastic. Notes of cinnamon and spice just a touch of bitterness in the middle but a sweet finish. Very clean.
On tap at St Augustines in Vancouver. A medium amber in color, with a bit of head. A very decent Belgian style ale. I cannot say more at this time.
Bottle. Pours gold, white head. Nose of wheat, spice, lemon-orange citrus. Flavour is lemon wheatiness with pepper, phenols are quite high. Finish is dry and thin. Alright, pretty much a wit.

Just an all around incredibly well made beer. Definitely feels rich in the mouth. A rich dense fruity nose with a floral lift. A beer I just cant stop smelling and tasting. I think it needs to definitely warm up in the glass to be fully expressive due to the dense richness. Getting really tired of overbuilt beers and appreciating more and more the importance of body and character and nuance. The kind of thing usually found in beers that have a generations in the making maturity to the recipe (Like Ayinger Dunkel, for instance). If this is where Dieu Du Ciel is now as a young brewery, it will be exciting to taste them in 50 years. If Im overstating this beer, Id like to know what imperfections Im missing. JoeBob says, "Check it out..."

Bière dorée trouble avec un col de mousse blanche persistente. Nez sur la levure et le levure (pamplemousse). Un beau compromis bien foutu !

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 341 ml bottle. Pours a clear amber with light head. Aromas of Belgian yeast; dried bananas, burnt rubber, and a bit of cloves. Flavors of stoned fruit, candy, yeast, toasted malts, and banana/rubber with some floral notes.
Bottle at brewdog... Golden amber... Thin white head... Soft floral... Light yeast... Light zezty nose... Soft dry fruit... Juicy fruits... Sift clean.. Light yeasty... Very fruity... Light sweet

Bu le 22 décembre 2013. Œil: jaune paille, peu de mousse. Arôme: floral, épices et malté. Bouche: pétillante, corps moyen, fruité et épices. Peu d'amertume et légèrement sucré. Bière douce.

On tap @ Beachwood BBQ. Nice hazed glowing orange pour with a white head. Nice sweet fruits, peach candy, and some grass on the nose. Good yeast, spice, and bread, too. Flavor is moderately sweet with a hint of tart peach candy. Lots of golden apple, grass, and bread. Yeast, flowers, and spice.

12oz bottle from Brewdog Camden. It pours a hazy golden body with a medium white head. Aroma is pretty spiced up with coriander, cloves, yeast. Taste is sweet belgian candy sugar, some yeast, citrus and mild banana, herbal hops. Silky body with lively carbonation. Very good as usual from DDC.
Smells clean and fresh...appearance is light with just the right cloudness...the taste is smooth hoppy with a crisp cutting finish...the is a true canadian ipa gem!

341ml bottle, pours bright hazy golden brown with a white foamy head. Hoppy aroma with citrus notes, orange and lemon, coriander,spice and not too assertive yeast notes. Well balanced, well made beer.
Bottle at Brewdog Birmingham; hazy amber pour with bubbly beige head, malt and earthy hop aroma, taste has orange a hint of spice that unwelcome yeast action you get from Belgian IPAs.

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une couleur troublée dorée peu de mousse. Cette bière entretien un nez assez long où ressort des notes citronnées. Aroma:fragrant spicey aroma

Sep 2014 - Keg at Brewdog.  Golden yellow, very slight haze, still, small white head.  Aroma has tangy alcohol, some shoe, musty.  Body is medium, pretty foamy.  Taste is generic blonde / tripel, slight sherbet. (3.4)
341ml bottle from BrewDog, Glasgow. Hazy yellow amber, decent head. Yeasty flowery spicy lemon aroma. Big fruity spicy flavour. Yeasty aftertaste. A very well balanced good Belgian style beer.

341ml bottle from Brewdog online shop. (7% on label?) Pours a clear straw yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of light bready malt, lemon zest and floral hops. Taste has light sweet, light bitter. Creamy texture, lingering floral finish. Turned out much better than initial impressions suggested.

341ml bottle into a tumbler. Pours a hazy straw colour with a light fluffy head and sparse lacing. Grassy and flowery nose with a bit of citrus, with a similar flavour and a hint of spiciness. Lingering dryness.

341ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy amber colour with huge massive white head. Aroma is citrus. Taste is spices galore! Some hopes. Very enjoyable brew.

On tap @sbwf13. Hazy deep golden with white head. Aroma of caramel, honey, bread, yeast, wheat and flowers. Taste is similar; sweet, caramel, yeast, bread, wheat, light banana with floral and citrus notes.

Pours a hazy yellowish orange with a frothy white head and lots of lace. Aroma of cloves, bubblegum, banana, apricot and some light floral notes. Taste is a nice blend of Belgian yeast and grassy/earthy hops. Nice blend of cloves and fruity sweetness and hop bitterness and a nice dry slick finish.

Poured from a 341mL bottle. Hazy golden yellow with whispy clouds inside and a white head. Belgian yeast aroma with some coriander. Sweet yeasty flavour overlapped with mild hops. Dry, but oily. Surprisingly well balanced sweetness to bitterness ratio.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2014 Bière Dorée-Jaune avec un col blanc durable. Au nez forte odeur dépice typique des bières styles belges. 341ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy straw colour with a huge, lasting head. Citrus aroma with a taste to match. Not too much hops, definitely more of the Belgian style ale in this beer, but it was still enjoyable.

Pours a hazy gold(though I noticed a decent amount of sediment in the bottle) with a small white head and little lace. Aroma is floral, sweet apricot, orange, spicy Belgian yeast, and bready malts. Flavour is spicy yeast, citrus, tropical fruits, medium bitterness, bready, and sweet caramel.

Aroma: tart; arpicots, citrus and yeast
Flavor: Tart! Hints of apricot; light yeast; light bread.

(bottle) pours a murky golden-yellow colour with a frothy white head. aroma of peanuts, floral hops, lemons, cactus juice, yeast, peppermint and powdered sugar. flavour is mostly the same, lots of yeast and powdered sugar, with some notes of kiwi, light gooseberries and oregano. medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation.

11.5oz bottle. Pours a hazy golden amber color with a large long lasting white head with some nice lacing. Smell is caramel, honey, bread, yeast, biscuity malts, spices, wheat, nice floral and fruity esters, spicy hops. Taste is very sweet caramel malts, yeasty bread, wheat, light banana and spice, very fresh floral/citrus character, very dry finish. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium to high carbonation
Not gettin the love on this one. Pretty flat and dull all the way around. I literally have nothing to say for this one. Just makes me shrug my shoulders.

Eucalyptus, is the first impression I get form this cute looking little blonde. Lemon tart, nice slight honey on the aftertaste. Not too bitter, not over-the-top yeasty like most belgian IPA I had lately. Im not loving that brew as much as I use to...

Bière orangée et trouble. Le nez donne dans le houblon herbacé. En bouche, beaucoup dagrumes (pamplemousse principalement) avec un peu dépices. Le statut de IPA belge sied davantage à cette bière que celui de blonde belge puisque les projecteurs sont effectivement tous tournés vers les houblons.

341ml bottle 7% ABV from LCBO. Very lively with a large foamy head that linger for quite some time. Golden yellow in colour. Malty tasting with heavy bitterness from the hops coming out at the end. Nice version of an IPA.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy pale gold with a beautiful pillowy white head that stands forever, with tons of lacing - exceptionally good looking beer. Aroma of flowers, citrus peel, stone fruit, a bit of cloves. Taste is clean and biscuity malt up front, leading to an assertive citrus-herbal hop finish. Great balance considering the style. By far the best "Belgian IPA" Ive had, and yet another remarkable Dieu Du Ciel beer.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a slightly hazy bright yellow with a thick white head. Aroma of citrus, flowery perfume, floral hops, peppery spices, earthy hops, coriander, cumen, and a touch of grassy hops. Flavor of grassy and earthy hops, lemon, tea, light fruits, with a bitter hoppy finish. Definitely more of an IPA than a Belgian ale but more floral and spicy than most IPAs. Great beer!
8/4/8/4/14 (3.8/5)

C'est très intéressant comme mix... L'amertume de IPA, une petite touche allemande et une douceur malté pour le côté belge ... Bière complexe mais terriblement facile à boire ... J'en boirais volontiers quelques canettes devant un bon concert de stoner ...
Une IPA rigolote , un houblon qui parcourt la bouche avec une touche de malt en la fin qui lui donne du caractère

Great beer. Pours a cloudy amber with lots of malt unless and fruitiness on the palate. Nice foam that lasts. Nice Belgian yeast flavors. Great beer.

Pour is hazy golden with a nice fluffy head, good retention and lots of lacing. Aroma is grassy, yeasty, bread, citrussy notes. Taste is moderate sweet, yeastym grassy and herbal hops, citrussy notes, crisp malts. Medium body and medium-low carb. I used to be a fan of this beer but i am pretty sure the recipe have changed and now its average for me. Sad.

A golden beer with a very big, cloudy, dense and blond head. The nose is strongly aromatic and fruitfull, lemony hops and some spices, apples. Complex and tastefull aroma. Taste is fruitfull, quite much of citrusfruity hoppyness and spicyness, some peppers and yeast. Medium bodied, high carbonation and acid, fresh. Complex and aromatic with strong hoppyness, nicely balanced beer.

Bottled in March, so understandibly the aroma is a bit faded, but some nice belgian yeast is coming through (smells bready, spicy almost a bit stinky with cattyness/socks) with a little bit of citrus and lemon. Very very big head, hard to control this one, lasts forever with a lot of foam? Hazy yellow color. Taste is very well balanced, citrus and light bitterness upfront, some spicyness and a light bitterness. Very well balanced, wish this one was a bit fresher so I could get some more of the hop aromas. Medium bodied and medium/high carbonation.

From 341 ml bottle. Pours a clear copper-amber with a fluffy white head and a few floaties. Pear, apple, banana, pepper, white bread and cinnamon on the nose. Flavours of fresh apple, raisin, pepper, lemon zest and a floral note. Velvety mouth feel with a lingering spicy and fruity aftertaste. Absolutely cracking Belgian style blonde.

Bottle - Some flowery and earthy hops, with grains and yeast. Pale clear gold with a thick bubbly head. Candy floss hops, grains and a nice balanced bitter finish. Great overall beer, upset I havent had it sooner.

Is this one of the most innovative & interesting breweries in Canada? It just might be. From the labels, to the packaging & most importantly the brews these guys have yet to disappoint me. This one pours honey blonde with a multiple finger picket fence white fluff cap (this is the cloud-like head that dreams are made of). Handed this pour to Dieter & he gave this his nod of approval. You get your Belgian, you get your Weiss, & you get your hops. Another winner.

Aroma is floral and citrus with yeast notes.

Medium body. Medium carbonation. Crisp with a dry, hop aftertaste that fades.
Very nice. Smell reminds me of a wit beer or saison but the texture isnt as watery.

341 mL bottle. Pours straw yellow with a huge foamy white head. Aromas of citrus peel, pear, ginger, floral hoppiness and a touch of bubblegum. Dry with high carbonation and medium mouth feel with a lingering finish layered with spicy old world hop. Reminds me more of a hoppy Tripel than an IPA per se.
Nice fruity and hay aroma. Pours hazy blonde with a foamy white head. Great Belgian flavors, fruity with a berry finish.

Bottle 34,1 CL. Pours hazy yellow with big bubbly head. Notes of hay, citrus, grass, fruity. Refreshing.

341 ml bottle, bb 01/13.label says 7%. Pre Tuska festival tasting.Hazy golden, lasting thick white head. Very fruity, yeasty, oranges, seasony-like notes. Flavor has orange, citrus,yeast, wheat. Long lasting semisweet finish. Incredible.
Bottled. Pours hazy orange with a foamy whitish head. Fruity citrus, bit of hay and light bready malty notes in aroma. Quite refreshing. Citrus, bitter hops and notes of summer meadow in taste.

341ml bottle from Liquor Depot in town. Connect stock might have been a little past its prime. Clear coppery golden pour with a bubbly white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is floral, earthy hops primarily, mild yeast note. Taste is fairly bitter, creamy mouthfeel. More of a Belgian IPA perhaps, as hop character dominates, but not to its discredit.

Bottle.  Pours crystal-clear pale yellow with a massive foamy head.  Aroma has light Belgian spice and noble hops.  Pleasant Belgian blonde flavour with a big bitter finish.  Medium-bodied.  I really liked this.
Acheté chez Brouhaha. Forte effervescence. Ça sent le chamvre. Couleur jaune orange opaque. Agrume, banane noisette. Bonne bière pour lextérieure...robuste, mais pas trop.

Decent, but aside from the house flavor - which plays too small a part here - forgettable. Nothing on the beers it takes its hints from.

bottle:  A sturdy yet session-able Belgian ale.  No outlandish tones. Nice bottle conditioning yields a fair amount of hazy yeast even with a gentle pour.  Active head still is produced as the glass sits with an ounce left.  Sticky lacing.

Bottle with some friends. Hazy pour with fluffy head. This must have been old or had some rapid temperature variation. We got mostly rust, copper, belgian yeast, and infected notes. Need to try again.

Gusher, probably an old ass bottle, purchased at WLV. It pours a yeasty amber witha  big off-white soapy head. Dry hopping is gone but it does have a nice smell. Initially it is oxidized but then it is pithy yet savory, plenty of citrus. Flavor is tropical fruit, peach, citrus, esters, slight spice. Really nice brew.

Cloudy, fruit-yellow with a thin, white cap.
Aroma is yeast, light fruit.
Taste is strongly peppered, bitter florals, mild sourness.
Very complex and extremely enjoyable.

Bottle 341 ml [2011]. Apperance: Pours golden orange with a small white head. Aroma: Fruity esters. Taste: Sweet. Wood, spices and a little bitterness at the end. Overall: Nice drinkable refreshing beer. Well balanced.

Pours pale orange, modest white head. Belgian yeast, esters, floral notes, bread, citrus lemon and pepper on the nose. More floral hops, bread, yeast . Medium to lighter bodied, same on bitterness. Pleasant and sessionable for the style.

On tap at Wvrst. Cloudy orange pour. Aroma is very similar to typical abbey ale. Orange peel, cloves, bready. Medium body. Nice complex balance. Yeast, caramel malt, citrus finish. Still refreshing despite its rich character. Nice and unique.

Yellow-orange, light haze, fluffy white head.  Biscuity malt aroma with citrus, spice and some apple.  Dry, cracker-like malt, a lemon-like citrus character, light spice and subtle sourness.  Medium body, refreshing, dry, somewhat bitter finish.

Refrigerated bottle obtained through trade with pushkinwow poured into a trappist glass.  Pours translucent yellow with finger of bright white head that has great staying power.  Some lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and yeasty aroma.  Taste is complex yeasty citrus and finishes dry.

(341ml bottle from LCBO, aged 1 year)  Poured into a Duvel tulip, dark gold in colour with a pillowy 1.5 inch head which left some Belgian lacing. Aromas could have been stronger, a little bit of spice, some citrus, dry yeastiness. Flavour better, pale malt, some honey sweetness is balanced by spice and a drying bitterness from the hops so it is not cloying. Fairly full-bodied and smooth in the mouth, carbonation soft and fairly Belgian in character.  As I remember, better without ageing so I will have to try it fresh again, but still quite enjoyable.

aroma: floral, alcohol, sweets
appearance: a great clear and tasty amber/golden color. A very nice solide rocky head

palate: creamy in mouth soft carbonation not far from british brewery tradition.

Beautiful yellow gold in hue, with yeasty esters floating inside. A nice subtle aroma of floral & herbs.  Sweet start with a light sour finish.  Wonderful beer for all seasons.

Single bottle purchased from Zyn Liqour in Calgary, AB on 11/06/2011.
