Light banana and clove some other spice that I have not been able to put my finger on.
Murky, chunky light brown. Aroma-bready, fruity, ....taste-creamy malts, slightly floral hops, coconut undertones. Clean and rich.

(Bottle at Maltainen Riekko, Helsinki) Poured golden and almost clear and turned cloudier later on. Head was medium sized and white. Aroma contained very strong fruity hoppiness, sweet honey like notes and Belgian style yeast. Palate was medium bodied with quite high carbonation. Flavours were hops, fruitiness, citricness, sweetness, honey, Belgian style yeastiness, saison like sourness and bitterness. Aftertaste was bitter and fruity.

34.1 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is dry phenolic, yeasty and slight fruity. Lingering fruity and yeasty phenolic. Light bitterness and dry finish. Lasting fruity impression.

Bottled. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Sweetness, fruits, light herbs in the aroma. Flavour of herbs, sweetness, fruits some spice and flowers. medium to full bodied. Dry herbal bitterness in the end.

Bottle 34,1 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours golden with some floating impurities and a rich off-white head leaving laces. Aroma of fruit and Belgian yeast. Medium body, fruits but extremely dry and almost astringent with a very dry finish. 080210

Pours a nice golden orange colour with a large frothy white head and has some sediment floating in it. The aroma is fairly sweet with hints of fruits like peach and apricot, there is some floral hops, spice and yeast as well. The taste is a little sweet and more bitter than the aroma would suggest. To the palate it is a little oily, average carbonation and a nice finish. Overall this is a great beer, I was pleasantly surprised by it.

Bottle/12 - Pours a quite cloudy orange amber in color with a medium white head that stuck around to produce minor lacing on the glass.  Aroma is  yeasty with light fruits (peach, apricot), some spices and some citrus hops.  Flavor is not quite what I expected... the lighter aroma belied the hoppy bitterness that this beer has.  Still some fruitiness (definitely peach) and citrus hops, but I am almost startled by the intensity of the flavor.  Finish is lingering and quite bitter.  Good, but a bit unusual...
Aroma of sweet fruity hops Has an of white head with lacing on the glass. Its a murky golden colour. Tastes of fruity hops with peach and a hint of aniseed.

33cl bottle at home.
clear yellow, thick smooth offwhite head.
wonderful citrussy, slighlty bretty, slightly sour, yellow fruity, yeasty, perhaps wheaty aroma. faint flowery hops top it off. very refreshing.
flavor is yellow fruity, quite bitter, mix of hops and spices probaly responsible for that.. somewhat less flowery than the aroma, and the flavor also have licorice, anise. a lot of taste for a 6.5% alc. beer. very refreshing but also very bitter at the same time. A little too spicy for my taste, a lot of the flavor seems to be from spices.

Botella. Quite hazy deep golden orange colour with floaties. Very nice big off-white creamy steady well lasting head. Fruity and pleasantly yeasty aroma with spice and hops. Good mouthfeel. Pleasant flavour of fruits, yeast, good hoppiness, some spice and citrus, alcohol and a pleasant dry bitterness. Fruity and yeasty hoppy bit spiced well lasting alco warming finish.

Pours a hazy, pale, golden color with a big white frothy head.  Aroma of citrus hops and fruits. Taste is light sweetness, lightly bitter,  and a little salty. Medium bodied, average carbonation, bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours an unclear amber beer with chunks and an offwhite head. The aroma is hops with citrus and orange. The flavor is likewise citrus and orange. The palate is sweet with some bitterness. Overall a good beer.

341 ml bottle. Hazy orange body with a small, dense white head. The nose is light malty, fruity and spicy with a nice yeast aroma. Flavor is light malty, some caramel, peaches, spices and yeast. Refreshing, relatively light, but a distinct and original flavor. Nice.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2010 Hazy blonde with a thin white foam. Pleasant fruity and citrus nose. Lively attack due to high carbonation, medium body, oily, with a good hop presence, a nice hint of acidity to give this beer a very refreshing profile. Finishes on a citrus notes and the oily hop presence lingering on. Very nice belgian pale ale.

Bottle. Murky medium yellow-orange body with dark swirling sediment, thick, puffy off-white head. Spicy, herbal nose with lemon and bread dough. Bready, dusty body, bitter with spice and old hops, with sweet cakey dough, lemon, and pineapple. Interesting and complex.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy hoppy aroma with some weak hitns of yeast. Sweetish malty spicy hoppy flavor with some floral hints. Has a sweetish malty spicy hoppy finish.

Clear golden with a medium white head. Sweet and yeasty aroma with fruity, malty and caramel notes. Sweet malty flavour with peaches, caramel, yeast and hoppy notes towards the end. Dry and somewhat bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a big firm white head leaving ropy lacing. Aroma is sweet and spicy, with softer notes of estery yeast and citrus peel. Very inviting. The palate is silky, with flavours of barley candy, marzipan, sweet spices and a finish the is dry and bitter. Well balanced and tasty, but a little on the sweet end for me to drink much more.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Very good Belgian style blond.  Gold color with nice, frothy head.  You can see the yeast floating throughout, but no off putting butter tastes or sourness.  I have never had this brewerys other beers, but I would try some of their other ones solely due to this beers qualities.

Bottled at Bishops Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm. Pours out in a hazy blonde appearance with a rich lively white foam. Rich and deep and really fresh aroma of yeast, vanilla, coriander and cookies with solid yet elegent hoppy notes of lychee, orange-peels and flowers. Medium-bodied with with notes of yeast, orange-peels, mild lemon, lychee, coriander and flowers. Smooth mouthfeel. Long rounded crisp medium-bitter finish of coriander, grass, lemon-zest, mild herbs, mint and flowers on a weak foundation of pale malts and cookies. Tasty, elegant and drinkable, one of the best Belgian blondes to date. Now I can understand why Dieu du Ciel has such a good reputation, since I was a bit underwhelmed by their other stuff.

11.5oz bottle: Appearance is a hazy light brown with slow fading white head, Aroma of floral hops yeast and oranges, Taste is pretty malty, some caramel and some cereal notes, along with a bit of yeasty notes and also some spices and floral hops. Probably one of the better non-Belgian Belgian style beers I have had.

Bottle: &nbsp Dull golden, hazy, huge frothy white head, sticky lacing. &nbsp Spicy nose, almost peppery. Bready on the tongue, slightly spicy in a sort of peppery way. &nbsp Has a bit of apple or pear fruit skin, immature, very 

far from being ripe. &nbsp Also has a bit of plastic that shows up as well. &nbsp Has a bit of a metallic astringency to it. &nbsp Very warming, somewhat alcoholic. &nbsp Finish is very spicy, burning spicy like. &nbsp Meh, perhaps not 

my cup of tea.
Cloudy ochre colour with tall foamy head - and ver

Bottle from Sergios - Pours bright golden with a mostly receding off-white head and plenty of floaties. Notes of herbal hops, pale malt, bitter floral hops, spicy clove, delicate floral esters. Full bodied with lively carbonation. An interesting beer, but not one that I could rave about.

Volonteeeee EH. Spicey grassy belgian yeast aroma. Flavor is sweet pastures. What I imagine the cows grazing on during the finest summer day. A bevy of sweet floral and grass notes mixed together to create a truly enjoyable experience.

Bottle (34 cl) at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg, Sweden. Hazy golden, rich white head. Malty aroma with marzipan, tropical fruits, and herbal hops. Meidum bodied and smooth. Dry with a bitter finish. Very nice!

Its unclear, golden with a lot of sediment and a white, creamy head. The aroma has notes of yeast, coriander, peach, citrus and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of coriander, yeast, citrus, citrus peel (a little harsh), malt and the finish is slightly dry and harsh.

Bottle at Bishops Arms, Vasagatan, StockholmHazy golden color; big creamy head. Malt and spicy aroma, Belgian yeast activity, not too exciting, but at least it has a light fruit touch. Medium bodied, there is some malt flavor, with a bitterness that surpasses the average Belgian Ale, and creates a drier profile for the malt. The final is strong and long, where the yeast spices are still present. Quite pleasant Ale.

341ml brown bottle drank 09.11.28 : Clear copper, med carbonation, rocky white head. Superb floral nose mix with fruity esters from yeast. It isnt too yeasty which make it really easy to drink. Body is low to med. Think about the complexity of the Orval minus the brett and you get this beer. A must have in anyone cellar.

Bottle 341ml. @ home.Clear light medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate to light heavy yeasty, soap, fruity, apricot, mandarin, coriander. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and peppery bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20091017]

THOUGHTS: Really nice. One of the better Belgian ales Ive had. A little too bitter at the end for the style, but still nice.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a cloudy, dark yellow with a large, off-white head that slowly diminished and incredible lacing. The aroma was moderate light bread; light resinous hops; moderate yeast; marmalade, light fruits and pineapple. The initial flavor was sweet and acidic; while the finish was sweet, acidic, slightly sour and a little bitter with and average to long duration. There was light fruits, yeast, bread, citrus, toast, more yeast, a little spice, some honey, floral hops and pineapple. The light to medium body was a bit creamy and then dry with fairly fizzy carbonation and a light to moderate astringent finish.

Pours a vivid orange color with white head.  Lots of floating sediment.  Spicy, hoppy aroma with notes of orange peel.  Full bodied, lots of spicy hops, coriander, essence of orange, wheaty malt, cloves, subtle notes of cinnamon and nutmeg.  Dry palate.  Very nice!
Hazy gold pour.  Yeasty aroma up front with some light spice, lemon, and floral hops.  Flavor is slightly sweet to go along with some nice yeast, spices and fruit.  Damn good.

Mmmmm - HMM!! Yessir, this is one FINE beer! Perhaps the best beer out of Canada Ive had yet. Poured with a huge, foamy, frothy, fluffy, textured, off-white head that lasts forever and loads of lace. Color is a moderately hazy amber. Aroma is floral, a hint of minerals, hops, malt, spice, and grass. Flavors all a that and more. Dryish up front with hints of sweetness that come and go. Little honey in there too. Good burps. Great body and carbonation. Pick up a touch of alcohol in the very end. Could sip this beer on and on and on.

Bottle shared by daknole. Pours cloudy golden color with white head. Fruit and yeast aroma with a lot of spices. Similar flavors with some light floral hoppiness. Light to medium body with lively carbonation.

Bottle. Nice clear orangey color with a white head with heavy lacing.  Piney hops, lemon, some maltiness and belgian yeast create quite a bouquet of aromas. Taste is full of pine and malt and a lslight belgian yeast side.
Draft at Volo. Pours cloudy goldern colour with frothy white head. Nice hoppy aroma. Hoppy bitterness upfront, belgian yeast, spice  and fruit notes. Finish is smooth.

Bottled at Bishops Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm.  Clear golden, rich airy firm head. Floral buckwheat aroma, pineaple andlychee. Sweetish and fruity with marzipan yeastyness. edium bodied with, well rounded mouthfeel. Drier finish. Aromatic orangey hops and Beögian style yeast character. Marked but unassaulting bitteress. A well made, interesting beer.

Has a very sweet smell which i find a little unpleasant.  Taste is full, with notes of perfume and flowers, which is a trend im noticing with alot of Dieu du Ciels beers.  Not a bad thing mind, its very refreshing and pretty.  I could not really call this an abbey style beer however, although it has a nice spiciness on the nose, its missing alot of the fruit and licorice notes common with this style of beer.

Bottle form Beer Store.  Hazy dark yellow with a fizzy white head.  Pleasant floral aroma of pear, nectar, and orange.  Flowery taste with fruit notes and a nice hoppy dryness and ending with a tremendous complexity.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2010 Pours a hazy gold, nice head.  Aroma is fantastic, loads of Belgian yeast, some spiciness, and a good floral note.  Flavor is a match, with plenty of light pale malts in the mix as well.  Hops are evident, but mostly add an earthy and floral character that blends seamlessly with the yeast notes.  The only drawback I could find was that the alcohol was evident in the flavor.  But really, an outstandingly well done beer.  Notes almost identical on 7/11/10

Slightly hazy golden with a lasting white head. Great yeasty aroma, with tropical fruits and complex spices, flowers and a little malt note. Dry and spicy flavour with grassy hops and a nice bitter finish. Pretty much the perfect Belgian blonde ale

Draught @ Bar Volo, Toronto, ON: Pours very light yellow, decent white head. Aroma is floral and soapy from hops, some citrus fruit and white pepper. Taste is quite bitter and astringent, spicy and just a little sweet. I actually found this one to be overrated but I offer kudos for hiding that extra alcohol, never would have pegged this for a 6.5.

Straw coloured with a bit of hazyness and a nice white head.Really nice sweetness, on the fruity side of things with some complexity but slightly less than a triple with a nice lower ABV. Really enjoyed this.

Immediate gorgeous blooming of sweetly fresh & aromatic hops is the main feature. Lots of rounded piney and poeachy hop flavors, rounded citrus, Absolutely smooth on draft, with a fairly full feel and perfectly balanced fruit. and malt sweetness. Grassy and spicy esp on finish, wonderful from A to Z. My favorite aspects of IPA and Tripel on a finely integrated beer.

[bottle--thanks akatico!]
Woody bitter aroma similar to Orval with some sweet malt and faint banana and flowers. Hazy (from my pour) copper with a lasting, rocky white top. Potent sweet malt flavour that has a touch of toffee, blended perfectly with full floral and spicy hops as well as a woody bitterness reminiscent of a young Orval. Medium body, medium carbonation, slightly dry bitter finish. Excellent.
Very nice Beligan! Flavor smooth, yet complicated. Deep, yet simple. Pours golden with white head. Hoppy and effervescent. Very dry on finish, yet slightly sweet on taste.

This Ale pours a yellow gold with some orange touches, appears to have a glow to it, gave a nice large foamy white fine bubbled head, aromas of yeast, light caramel sweetness, pale malt, hop grass and flowers, flavors of pale malt, malt bread sweetness, has a medium bitterness at the finish, there was hop bite bitterness and some bitterness from alcohol warmth(?), I am not sure if I tasted alcohol or not, this beer is hoppy for a blonde ale, may be some pepper on the tongue at the finish to, mouth feel is around medium with some creaminess, a nice drink, this beer has more of a hop presence than what I was expecting.

Bottle. Poured clear orange with a thick off-white head. There were a good number of particles floating in the beer. Aroma was sweet with a light hop profile while there are clear belgian yeast present. A bit of spiciness on the tongue with sweet malts and light hops.

Pours hazy orange with frothy off-white head.  Aroma of floral and citrus hoppiness meld well with some slight cola and belgian yeast notes and great subtle spiciness.  Flavor is unlike any blond ale that Ive ever tried.  Spicy notes emerge almost immediately alongside citrus hops and a really delicious rich malt-yeast-cola-fruit ester backbone, finishing with a pleasant hop bitterness.  The best blond Ive had thus far.

Enjoyed from an 11.2oz bottle in an elongated tulip glass.  The beer pours a medium yellow to lightish golden color with a fluffy white head.  The nose gives characters that seem to place the beer broadly within the style of a Belgian Blonde ale.  This is confirmed by the abv.  Given this, my benchmark for comparison was Leffe.  This beer surpasses the aforementioned in every conceivable way.

The nose is tremendously complex, showing first some European hop character, followed by a deep and rich malt note (pilsner + munich + aromatic + a touch of special "B"?), followed by yeast-derived esters that gives notes of banana, pear, and a bit of apple.

The palate backs up the down payment afforded by the beers aromas.  A tremendous erray of malt-derived flavors greets the drinker in the approach.  The beer almost tastes like a great English ESB made with continental malts and yeast.  Tremendous.

Overall, this redefines the style for me.  Worth seeking out and paying nearly any price for.

Pours a very murky dark burnt yellow with a tall, pillowy off white head that looks a bit like vanilla ice cream has amazing retention and leaves nice lacing.. Aroma is bright citrus, grass, strawberry blossom, light straw, tangerine and light bread dough. Flavor is buttered sourdough, citrus, nice caramel, strawberries, orange, cream, slightly salty pasta, and a little pepper to the finish. Palate is light to medium bodied, creamy on entry and slightly dry, but still fairly creamy on the finish. Really nice stuff.

Bottle. Pours beautifully cloudy light golden coloured and very bubbly with a big dense lasting and lacing egg white head. Aromas of yeast, floral hops, orange fruit, malt and spice. Flavours of sweet malt, spice, yeast and bitter hops. Delicious brew.
Bottle at home - shared with Mette og Jørgen. Cloudy yellow - white head. Flowery, perfumed, herbal, light hoppy, citrus, zesty, light phenols, light yeasty, peppery.

Pours a hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Sweet malty nose with a good citrus and pepper character. Well balanced, sweet malts and citrusy peel, hop bitterness and pepper. The yeast adds nice character.  Smooth mouthfeel and medium body. Very nice beer.

Bottle @ VinensVerden, Odense. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy lasting white head and lacings. Nose is yeasty, floral, vanilla, hoppy and fruity. Very inviting and well combined.  Taste has lots of orange peel, a bit of pepper, spices and hops. Smooth and dry. A tasty beer for certain.

Bottle. High fluffy and long lasting white head leaving nice lacings. Hazy orange body with a lot of sediments that looks like orange peal. Powerful barley malt aroma with fruity and spicy notes. Complex mixture of fruit and spices on a basis of a good malt flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long bitter aftertaste. Alcohol level seems just right.

Bottle, bought @ Havnens Vin & Tobak, Vejle.
Pours muddy pale yellow with a wonderulf, creamy, white head. Aroma is wonderful. Wheaty sweetness, lemons, ginger, yeast, oranges and cloves. Light bretty notes. Highish carbonation, fine and light mouthfeel. Sweet flavour, and it almost feels like a Saison. Pepper, ginger, yeast, wheat, oranges, lemons, banana, green apple and cloves - and just the right amount of hops. Wonderful.

Bottle at home.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of spices, yeast and hops with notes of brett and wallonian barnyard.
Fruity flavour of spices, yeast, hops and grass with notes of brett and alcohol.
Spicy and warming alcoholic finish.

Bottle. Unclear yellow with some floaties and a steady medium white head. Very fruity and spicy aroma. Some hops and coriander. Flavour is quite hoppy with a good spicy punch. Ends up fruity and bitter. Creamy texture. Very nice.
Straw yellow color with a soapy white head.  Cloudy with floaties.  Aroma of hops and citrus.  Flavor is citrus, hops, pine, with a nice sweet ending.  This is very very good!

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of all foam finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a very hazy softly carbonated yellow colored body and thick foamy lacing. The aroma was malty and musty. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of malt mild hops breads coriander and tart. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.

Pours a cloudy golden-orange color with a huge foamy white head that quickly settles into a thin lacing that lasts. Citrus and floral hop aroma with some pine, citrus fruit and sweet maltiness. Perfect balance of hops, fruit and yeast, with hints of golden crisp apple and pear and subtle spices. Bitter hops up front with creamy smooth fruit center and dry hop finish. Very good!
Nice babyfood banana and apricot aroma. Cloudy golden, full of floaties, medium snow white head, some lacing. Malty apricot flavor. Grassy palate. Pretty good, but lacks anything that sets it apart.
Aroma of spice, citrus, orange. Pours a very nice cloudy orange with thick foamy head. Spicy, sweetness. Smooth finish.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy sticky looking amber with a large creamy white head.  Sweet fruit, pears, candy, honey.  Medium bodied, but a little empty.  Not much of the nice aromas carry over into the body.  Some light candy maltiness, and a nice quinine like bitter at the end.
Cloudy golden color with a decent white head. Aroma is of fruit, light floral, yeast and spice. Taste is spicy, yeast, fruit, citrus.
Poured hazy golden yellow, yeasty, fruity, citrus, little spice, dry finish.

I had this one with my good buddy J.  Poured a cloudy golden with a quickly dissipating white head.  Smells very fruity and flowery, almost overbearing.  The taste was just as putrid and it had a dry finish.  I wasnt a big fan of this junk.

Sampled at vt brewfest 09. Pours a cloudy yellow/orange with a small white head. Aroma of spicy yeast, fruit, citrus and floral. Flavor was yeasty with citrus fruit and some spiciness with a medium body and has a dry finish.

Bottle at the Monks Kettle S.F. This golden ale poured with a decent white head and a floral aroma. Lots of floaties.  The flavor is caramel malt with a nice yeast presence,  subtle hop bitterness and a dry finish.

11.5 oz. bottle.  Pours a very hazy gold with a thin-moderate linen white head that faded to a thick ring after the first two sips and lingered to the end, leaving partial lace.  There are a lot of white chunks floating about, not just some little specks but fairly substantial pieces as well.  It really doesnt look all that appetizing.  The aroma is very nice with lots of Belgian yeast, lemon, and floral notes.  The flavor is nowhere near as bright and lovely as the aroma.  Initially, there is some muted Belgian yeast, however, this is overrun by a considerable dose of hot black pepper.  Hot, bitter and very dry at the finish.  This beer is definitely not for me.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2009 Pours a five finger off-white head that fades slowly leaving a good lace. Cloudy amber color with a ton of yeast floating. Light carbonation and light-medium bodied.   Belgian yeast nose. Flavor is citrus and Belgian yeast with light grapefruit aftertaste.  $4.29 for a 11.5oz bottle from Beverage Warehouse Winooski, VT.

12oz bottle...pours a cloudy, opaque golden yellow color with a thick white foamy head. Leaves nice lacing on the glass. Head is quite large then receeds to about a finger. nose is lovely, sweet but somewhat floral notes, a light ricey kind of graininess in the nose as well. Palate is full and thick with a very nice velvet/fluffyness about it, but not airy. fairly flat for the amount of bubbles that race through the beer. Flavor is grainy with some light sweetness but it really is quite dry. Some spiciness as well.

Bottle. Clear amber pour with a tall, sturdy white head. Aroma is very floral and spicy with dried fruit notes, candy, yeast and perfume. Taste is big yeast notes, dusty malts, big flower notes, perfume, candy, fruit, peppery spices and bitter hops.  Body is light and very bubbly. Lots of carbonation to this. Very dry overall. Ends with more spices, fresh cut flowers, bitter hops, Belgian yeast notes, light honey, perfume, dried fruit, dusty malt, and herbal notes.

Bottle.  Nice golden pour with a thin white head.  Sweet candy yeast with spice in the nose.  Pepper and hops at the forefront with a nice Belgian yeast undertone, finishes a bit tart.  Smooth body with good carbonation.  Nice beer.

Pours hazy dark amber with a large off-white head.  The aroma has mildly toasted malt, estery, some spice and earthy yeast - also quite dry for the style.  Medium smooth body with a bit of graininess and some sharp carbonation.  The flavor starts off quite spicy with black pepper, some malt, Belgian yeast and continues with the dryness aspect.  The finish has lots of phenolic spice coming into the mix.  Enjoyable beer.

Bouteille: Poivre, citron, levure, pêches, houblon, mangue, tangerine; caractère rustique de la ferme et de la saison des foins; meringue; robe jaune orangée opaque; une bière extraordinaire!
En fût: Une bière extraordinaire encore une fois mais qui, à mon avis, perd un peu de sa splendide (et néanmoins accessible) sauvagerie... ?

Pours a bright golden orange with a one finger white head. Beautiful in a glass. The nose is very spicy and fruity, estery, mildly sweet, citrus rind. Flavor is yeasty, peachy, spicy waxy hop presence, orange/citrus rind. Palate is spicy and nicely carbonated.

Bottle. Pours golden, white head. Mild hop aroma, light notes of honey, orange. Flavor is simple and good. Very mild, delicate pale malt sweetness, followed by citrus hop flavors that build into an intense finish. Hopiness lingers. Balanced with some nuance. The more I drink, the more I absolutely love. Excellent.
11.5 oz bottle. Pours hazy deep golden in color. Aroma spicy, banana and bready. Taste sweet, spicy and citrus with bitter and dry finish.

Golden orangish in color, cloudy look, and has a pretty decent off white head.  The smell is a little grass, spices, fruits, flowers, and yeast.  The taste is a grassy hop, fruits, yeast, very belgian.
Straw colour with sediment in settled in the glass.  Citrus nose with spice.  Taste is medium body with flavour of citrus, spice.  Really enjoy this today on my back patio with the sun shining.

11.5oz bottle from grape & gourmet. pours a very nice hazy, yellow gold with tons of yeast floaties and a thin, white head with great lacing. aroma is pure belgian with notes of spicy clove and cinnamon, fruit notes of banana and melon, and bready, sweet yeasty notes backed by a bit of pepper. flavor is very good with citrusy notes of orange and lemon up front with sweetbread malts, caramel, and belgian spices on the back end. palate is medium bodied with solid carbonation and a dry, herbal hop finish with a touch of honey. overall, a very good hoppy belgian.
11.2 oz bottle. Hazy gold, lotsa floaties, big white head. Bready nose, sweet and spicy, some citrusy notes. Sweet bready flavors, spicy. Body on the thick side of medium, nice lace. Good stuff!

11.5 ounce bottle from Bruisin Ales. Pours a golden color, hazy, with a large white head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma is bread, lots of spice and lots of citrus and other fruit notes. Taste is caramel, bread, toffee and spice. Dry finish. Medium-full bodied. Good beer.

Great hazy peach pour with one finger white head and thick lacing. Aroma is predominantly citrus ans spicy yeast. Clove and banana compliment an almost pine like hop character. Flavor is very well spiced- tons of coriander and clove complimented by a multitude of fruity notes. Palate is quite full for the style, leaving a dry finish that begs to be replenished. Excellent.

Pours a nice hazy peach with evident yeast sediment and a creamy head. Aroma has lots of spice notes, with clove, coriander, and fruity esters. Flavor is very nice- starts with a standard belgian ale flavor of spice and fruit, but the finish has a very nice hoppiness to it. A really solid effort by DDC- damn tasty brew.

12 oz.  Bright, clean, golden color.  Prominent and forceful head.  Nose of sweet honey, hops, and some spicy element, white pepper maybe.   Palate is decent, flavor drops off a bit on the finish.   Golden-esque but with more hop character.  Nice hybrid of styles   Smells like Chanterelle Mushrooms!  Apricots and earth!

12oz bottle. Pours a bright gold and a big lacy head of tight white bubbles. Aroma is actually more like an APA or sweet IPA. The flavors have some elements of an abbey ale, sweet and mildly spiced but the hop character really cover it up. Im kinda confused by this conflicting characters of this beer.
cloudy gold with thick off white head.  faint fresh flower aroma a little fruit.  slightly sweet flavor with a little citruis and pine hops.
Hazy yellow-orange with thick cream colored head.  Aroma is floral, fruity, with a hint of hops.  Lots of small bubbles make it very fizzy feeling.  Light malt flavor with solid hop finish.
Bottle. Pours a hazy, light orange, very thick, slightly off-white head. Aroma is very subtle, sweet malt. Flavor is sweet malt and some sublte fruit notes, maybe some spices in the background.

12oz bottle shared by Dogbrick.  Cloudy gold pour with a big white head.  Sweet malt aroma that is very yeasty and slightly tart.  Peppery flavor with some sweet malt and some unexpected hops in the finish.  Pretty dang good for a Belgian.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with loads of floating sediment. Thick creamy white head. Aroma is of tangerines, spice, pine, bread, oranges, banana on the nose. Tastes like a fusion of an IPA and a triple. Very hoppy, some high alpha PNW hops were used in this brew. Tangerine, grapefruit, oranges and lemons, pine and resin, spice (lots of spice), hints of banana and bubblegum close to the finish and a nice dry hoppy finish. Palate is lively, light fine bubbles. Nice beer. Really like this brewery!

Cloudy gold with tons of sediment and a half-inch white head. Sharp, fruity nose. Flavor is sweet fruit with a dash of grapefruity hop bitterness. Notes of wood and earth. Nice body and good lacing. High carbonation and a tangy, dry finish. Nice.

This brew pours a hazy yellow color with a medium thin ivory white head that recedes steadily. Stringy lacing on the glass. Light spices and yeast in the nose. Medium body with flavors of citrus, yeast and spices, especially pepper. The finish is fruity and sweet with a yeast and spice aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

DRunk from goblet. Pours Orange with a thin white head. Nice lacing and lots of susspended sediment. Aroma is very fresh and crisp with notes of banana and spices. Flavour is sharp crisp and very dry. Not the most interesting beer I have ever had and it is a little week for a belgian. All in all not too bad.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2010 Opaque cloudy orange, thick creamy beige head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and candi sugar, ripe fruit and berries also. Taste is bitter initially with doughy malts. Lots of flavor, very Belgian, medium body, smooth carbonation.
Butters BIg Blowout - Pours a cloudy golden color with white head. Malty aroma with citrus and banana. Taste the same, with dry hop finish. Not bad.

Bottle shared at Butters Big Cellar Blowout.  Hazy yellow pour with suspended particulate with white head.  Like a hefe.  Spicy pepper, banana, lemon.  Just average, and definitely not worth the price.
Butters cellar blowout tasting party funtime . Pale straw yellow in color. Lemon orange flavors. A sour biter good time.  Banana yeast.
Bottle at Butters Cellar Blowout.  Pours an eggshell color head with a golden body.  Smells of yeast and a little homebrew.  Flavor is yeast, dough, some banana and clove.  Nice finish.
Arômes de bananes et dépices. Douce aux départ, elle devient très épicée et légèrement fruitée avec un fini moyen dalcool et de houblon.

Pours gold, effervescent, hazy with sediment.  A tall creamy head persists and leaves generous sediment.  Aroma is equal parts floral honey notes and yeast.  Flavor is floral, fruit blossoms, sweetness balanced by a yeasty funk.  Decidedly spicy, clove, black pepper.  Medium to full bodied, smooth but peppery mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2009 Courtesy of northernbrews

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate orange and peach along with honey and pepper.  It pours a cloudy golden-orange with lots of sediment and a creamy white head.  The flavor starts with orange and peach.  The finish has light-moderate floral hops and pepper.  Medium bodied with a soft mouthfeel.

12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy medium golden color with a fluffy off white head that left great lacing.  Great nose of citrus, banana and Belgian yeast.  Flavor is fruity with citrus, banana and other tree fruits.  Finish starts sweet then finishes off dry, damn good stuff.

Citrus and light malt aroma with fruity notes. Light sourness and some spices. Rose colored body with tight bubbly white head. The head on mine had a good duration which helped with the palate.  Flavors are malt, some hops, some hay and grass, with a bitter finish.  Some dried fruit. Mouth is a bit creamy from the head with a drying bite. Enjoyable.

bottle.
Pours a pale golden color, thin tight head that clears to a ring quickly.  Sticky sweet flowery nose- very heavy, thick sweet aroma.  Flavor develops much more balance and depth than the nose, with a quick and sharp spicy hop bite on the front, muted sweet caramel and toffee notes in the background.  Very dry and astringent on the palate, in a very good way.  Some booze shows up in the finish.

Insanely perfumey, flowery nose, with definite acetone elements. Strong hop flavors - astringent, drying. Cottony body, pillowy. Good, but intense, flavors. I would like to age this - properly (this was a dusty bottle obtained at Ye Olde Beer Shoppe)...
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Bottle from West Lakeview, Chicago.  Cloudy orange with large white head.  Nose is citrus, lemon, grapefruit, yeast, off-dry, apricot, some spice, nice.  Flavor is dirty fruit: grapefruit, apricot; yeast, spice, alc,  maybe a little perfume, dry, Medium to thin with lively carbonation.  Nice but dirty and alc at the same time.

Pours dirty gold with thin white head. The aroma is very fruity and candy  like with notes of apple, apricot, yeast and spice. The taste is very spicy with yeast spice notes and cinnamon. Those flavors are soon followed by big fruitiness by midway from apples, pears and apricots. It ends with a bit of Belgian candi sugar.

Thanks retorp for the share.  Pours hazy yellow-orange with nose of Belgium: yeast, citrus, faint apple, spice, citrus, and an enjoyable caramel/toffee note.  Flavor is much the same with pieces of caramel, hops, booze, and a dry finish.  Enjoyable.
Hazy and chunky pour of burnt orange. Spicy aroma, with floral, lemon, and yeast. Peppery at first, with notes of cinnamon and coriander. Nice earthy hoppy finish

12oz bottle pours a slightly hazy, yellow orange with a frothy, clumping, lacing white head.  Aroma has plenty of yeasty esters, bananas, clove, spice, some gentle sweetness, tropical fruits.  Flavor is very similar, spices and bananas, yeasty, a little bready, flowers, some more sweet fruits.  Finish is sweet and slightly chalky.  I dont know that this beer is a knockout, but its really drinkable and a great representation of the style.  It was a tad expensive but overall very nice.
Thank you Jim Daley for your generous wedding present. Beer poured a clear golden blond. Taste was yeasty, sweet, with a dry bitter finish. Fantastico!
Mild citrus, subtle yeastiness, a nice representation of the style, and another great beer from DDC
Opaque gold,large white head.Faint spicy yeast nose.Light citrus(orange) start, spicy yeast,lots of wheat malt sweetness

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2010 Another Dieu du Ciel that is simply fantastic.  OK, if you get the bottle bottom lees in your glass, as I just did, the look is awful but who could care if the taste is great?  Well, I still do a little especially with this bottle because theres so much, like if I had mixed the beer with flour.  Golden-yellow color, lasting laces of foam, but what matters, the taste, is really delicately sweet, fruity (citrus, pear), slightly bitter and even more in the finish.  Great but aged in Pinot Noir barrel, it really becomes divine!

Bottle.  Pours a dull orange with a frothy white head.  Aroma is spice, hops, citrus, and other fruit.  The taste is pretty bitter up front ending in a citrus, fruit, and yeast characteristic.  Crisp finish overall....solid beer.
Hazy dull orange pour with frothy egg shell colored head , and drippy lace.  Citrus, tropical fruit, and spice.  Hoppy upfront with a dry spicy, and crisp finish.

11.5 oz.  Hazy orange pour with a sticky white head.  Smells great, and fresh.  Hops, orange zest, yeast, pineapple, marmalade.  Flavor is less exciting - pithy citrus in the middle with a mild, watery finish.  Sort of a belgiany IPA I guess - balanced, and I dont really have anything bad to say about it.

11.5 oz brown glass twist-top. No freshness date. Bottled conditioned.

Appearance: Nice golden hue with hints of amber. Sudsy white head which grips the Duvel tulip. Lots of particles even though a gentle pour.

Nose: Banana peel, spicy yeast notes, a little white pepper, sweet orange.

Palate: Moderately carbonated given the conditioning. Wow! Spicy on the back, lots of black and white pepper notes dancing with some earthy and fruity flavors. Green banana, leaves (wet and dried), tree bark, and some citrus. A really dry finish.

Notes: Wasnt impressed right up until I put the beer in my mouth. Aroma/appearance were decent enough, but the spicy pepper thing on the palate really won me over. The finish is a little odd, and reduces some of the "drinkabilitly." A good beer.
Crushed with Jakebra.  Nice nose.  Some cloves, other spices, sweet malts.  Flavor is about the same, not quite as spicy, but still just as nice with a great, dry finish.  Enjoyed drinking this one.
Pours a nice dark-tea body with visible sediment chunks. Nose is strongly belgian but taste is more hoppy than a belgian; probably the British style coming through.
12 oz bottle. Pours awesome body, hazy orange with sediment. Aroma is malt and monk with some alcohol. Taste is a bit hoppy, no sweet malt, not much alcohol as the aroma suggests.

Pours clear at first, theres lots of yeast at the bottom of this one. A few small yeast "floaties".  Tall, thick, long lasting white head that leaves a gorgeous lace on the glass.
Orange marmalade on toast aroma. 
The flavor is lightly sweet with some dryness at the finish. Spicy and interesting.
A beautiful cloudy blonde pour. Smells of muted spices. Tastes sweet but mellow and balanced with a dry finish. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2010 341 ml bottle in 3 pistole glass. Big foamy white head. Malty and fruity aroma. Hints of orange and coriander. A bit dry and hoppy in the end. Warm alcohol after that and a tiny bit bitter. Spicy and carbonated feeling on the palate. Nice complexity. Great beer ! Rating #23. 100211 Re-rate from Tap at St-Jerôme. Way better than the bottled version. More fresh and crips hops. More yeast esters. Mind blowing ! Aroma from 6 to 8. Taste from 7 to 8. Total score from 3.7 to 4. The bottle I had was probably not very fresh.

Bottle into chalice.

Pours a cloudy light copper, with a beautiful, thick, creamy off-white cap.

Nose is nice and yeasty, spicy, with some tropical fruit poking through.

Taste is yeasty up front, very peppery and spicy, with a lightly fruity, dry, doughy malt note underneath. A grassy hop bitterness peeks through near the finish, blending with the the black pepper note, and along side the big spicy yeast note. Exhale is doughy, hints of apricot. Finish is long, bitter, peppery.

Mouthfeel is lush and creamy, light.

An exceptional take on one of my favorite styles. Fantastic.

Bottle poured into a snifter, big frosty white head... Light orange in color. Nice aroma of light grassy hops. Texture is smooth. Really easy to drink. Taste is light touch of hops, fruityness and some yeast/bread characteristics.  Also some spices. On the dry side with a medium carbonation leve. Overall I am impressed.

Solid if not too exciting. Pours a nice golden color with white head, good retention. Aroma is yeasty with some hops. Taste is bread, Belgian yeast, honey, light fruits and mild hops. Not very complex but extremely drinkable.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2013 11.2oz bottle from Sams, Durham. Straw yellow pour with a one finger head, fairly thick and with good sticky retention. Modest nose has some character, with soft floral notes and some pert yeast. Crisp and dry taste, but not overwhelmingly so, with just a hint of pepper in the finish and lingering light fruit flavors throughout. Impressive.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours hazy golden straw color with a huge fluffy lasting white head.  Lacing was thick and chunky.  The aroma is an inviting mix of fruits, peppery spice, pale malt, and light floral hops and grass.  The flavor begins on a silky smooth note with lemon zest, yeast, pale malt, and fruit.  Mid palate the peppery spice kicks in leading to a slightly hoppy (floral) drier somewhat bitter finish.  Medium bodied and for the most part smooth.  There is a slight spice burn in the middle.  Very interesting and enjoyable.

Bottled.  Poured medium golden with a fluffy, well-retained cap of white head.. looked great in the glass!  The aroma picked up lots of white peppery yeast, cloves, and mild star fruit over a pale malt base.. tangy and engaging.  The flavor had pale malts and some light fruit on the drier core with all of the aforementioned spices abundant around it.. bitterness was present in the form of cat pee and floral notes.. finished spicy and bitter.  Medium-bodied with higher carbonation on the palate.. spices worked very well and kept it interesting throughout.  Great brew!

Bottle.  Pours a very nice lemony yellow with an aroma of zesty spring spices and light pepper.  Nice white head.  Flavor is buttery coriander with hints of lemon peel.  Nice mouthfeel.  Definite repeat.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Pours a hazy golden color with a big, foamy white head that shows great retention. As it finally settles patchny lacing circles the glass. The aroma shows notes of spicy floral hops, citrus, dry wheat, and some toasted bready malt. The flavor is equally nice with orange peel and lemon blending nicely while the floral hops dry things out and add their natural bitterness. This is hoppier than I thought it would be, but that is a good thing. Medium bodied mouthfeel and very well carbonated that is very easy to drink. Nice, dry, and refreshing finish. Really nicely done here. Another solid brew from this brewery.
0.34l - Good take on a tripel.  Metallic distraction midsip really brought hte maerks down.

Hazy yellow gold under a lasting white head and a sticky, stringy lace. Fruity, floral aroma, hints of honey, lemon, and a faint peppery spice. Medium body and effervescence, dry palate.A lot going on in the flavor with a light malty sweetness, some acidity, some sourness in the background, and a spicy bitterness to finish it off. Very nice, lots of flavor and aroma.

Bottle. Some floral notes but also some yeasty bread. Yellow body with white head and some crud floating around in the glass. Some fruits but mainly the yeasty bread flavor light spice added. Is rather smooth on palate but the drynesss lingers makes you yearning for either water or a refreshing brew to cleanse the palate.

Bottle. Huge very fizzy white head with poor retention, very nice lacing, lively, fast rising carbonation, hazy, and a yellow hue. The aroma was very nice-malty, yeasty, hoppy, floral, fruity, and spicy. The flavor was sweet, malty, hoppy, spicy, fruity, and a short dry finish. The mouthfeel was mostly smooth and slightly tingly and medium bodied. A nicely balance beer, easy to drink, refreshing on a warm Indiana summer day, worth a try, would definitely drink this again. More please!

Thanks MartinT! Nice hazy golden appearance with freaky sediment, medium white lacing head. Fantastic aroma of hops, resin, some caramel and fruits. Resiny mouthfeel too with hop, some citrus and orange peel taste, fine malt in the background. Dry hoppy finish, aftertaste. Yes, the beer is a mix of  belgian and english brewing traditions. Fine!
pale yellow color with a big head, the aroma is somewhat antiseptic with mild clover and honey aromas and some obvious hops. The taste reminds me of a glacier spring that a spruce tree fell into.

Bottle thanks to gethinbeer.  Pale golden amber beer.  Aroma is lovely.  Soft zesty hop aroma.  A light Belgiany maltiness and a bit of light bubble gum aroma as well.  There is a bit of zesty hop aroma along with a bit of citrus.  A kiss of lemon peel and a light perfumy zestiness.  Fruity and lightly spicy hops.  Earthy/herbal hops over a touch of crackery character.  Quite spicy and herbal with a fairly hoppy finish.  This is really lovely, complex stuff.

12 oz bottle.  Hazy blonde in color with a medium to large lasting white head.  Aroma is phenolicy, bready, and earthy belgian yeast with a touch of esters, vanilla and earthy hops.  Taste is lightly estery and moderately phenolic with alot of bready pils malt, mild citrus, vanilla.  Moderately hoppy with a smooth bitterness in the finish.  Medium bodied, slightly creamy texture.  This one of the best belgian pales I’ve had.

Bottle: Pours a hazy gold with a mediumish white head. Aroma, bananas, bubble gum, some pepper, cloves. Flavor, bready, yeast, fruity notes, bananas, wheat, cloves. Lively carbonation, light bodied, with a sweetness on the back end along with the spiciness.

Epicer (clou de girofle et poivre) et fruiter (bananes, ananas). L alcool vient rechauffer un peu. Bonne.

Spicy (clove and pepper) and fruity (bananas, ananas). Warming feeling form the alcohol. Good.

Bottle pours hazed orange yellow with a monster Belgian head and cobwebs of lace.  The aroma is banana and peaches, yeast, spice, cloves, and some hops.  The flavor is banana clove, coriander, with a bitter finish.  The palate is pretty rich and somewhat still under all the foam.  Overall, I like it well enough.

12 oz bottle into shaker.  Pours a really hazy golden.  The bottle has a quarter inch layer of yeast at the bottom, in the true DDC style (why?).  Big white rocky head that holds much better than expected, and it leaves some nice lace too.  Smells really nice - yeasty, wheaty, clovey, banana, creamy pale malt all in a much better balance than I have encountered with the style.  The flavor has great balance too with a bit of a tartish dry finish.  Medium to light body with effervescent carbonation.  Overall: very nice.

Bottle.  Golden / yellow pour.  Aroma is some spicey yeast, hops, and light belgian malt.  The flavor is mostly spicy / grassy, the spice is maybe coriander.  There is also light citrus and a small amount of sweetness.

Wow! Delicious Belgian ale with a ton of flavor. Aroma was the only average thing about this beer- grass and a hint of yeast. Pour was perfect and stunning. Deep dark orange with so much suspended yeast floating around it looks like you are looking into the night sky. Taste was very full and rich. Strong orange, apricot and spice. An apple/pear aftertate fills the back of the throat after the strong carbonation stops pricking. Great Belgian style beer.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Very large super dense and creamy head of very fine bubbles.  Insane carbonation keep a nice thick head on this brew.  Reduces slowly.  Light lemon aroma with some cereal grains, yeast, flowers  and spices.  Color is a medium golden orange.  Spicy flavor with more lemon and a good helping of dryness and hoppy bitterness.  Very dry actually and very lively in the mouth.  Lingering bitter and hoppy flavor.  A darn good belgian.  More hoppy than most but if you like hops then this is right up your alley.
Gold color with a large head.  Big bread and yeast aroma, finishing with a floral, Noble hop.  Light grain flavor, floral and hoppy.  A little honey sweetness.  Really quite nice.

11.5oz bottle, five dollars for a single of this at stores in DC.  Ouch.  Having been to Dieu du Ciel, I have the fullest respect for them however.  Cloudy golden orange color, very nice.  Big head, still waiting for it to die down.  Hops and Belgian yeast in the aroma.  The creaminess of a good Belgian Ale with lots of hoppy freshness on top of it.  Oh, to live in Montreal.  This beer is awesome!
Looks and smells like GI Matilda. Tastes hoppy and dryer. Really good!

Pours a hazy gold color with a pillowy thick white head. Malty sweet candy aroma with a noble hop bitterness. Nice body, smooth malty with an explosion of bitter hop goodness in the taste. Nice use of the hops, really provides a compliment to the sweet malt and sugars. Very good.

Pours a hazy apricot color from the bottle with a frothy off-white head and a noticable amount of sediment.  Loaded with the flavors of red apples, mild citrus, salty hops, and faint cream.  Finishes with plenty of yeast and alcohol.  Well balanced.

Pours a hazy golden color with thin off-white head.  Aroma is of yeast, citrus fruit, apple and light banana.  Taste is of must, yeast, fruit, and light malt.  Palate is slightly dry but finishes clean.  Much like a Saison IMHO.  Good.

Pours a crisp yellow color with a large foamy white head that slowly recedes and leaves webs of foamy lacing.  Aroma is very Saison-like; yeast, bananas.  Taste is citrus, banana, bubble-gum, and yeast.
Sweet yeasty aroma belies the dry, hoppy flavor.  Aroma seems to have hints of dry starfruit.  Flavor is less interesting than the aroma, as it often is.

8-2-08 bottle thanks to BlackForestCO 
Cloudy yellow orange with a nice decently long lasting fluffy head and spotted lacing.  Smell is sweet with a touch of tartness and a slight touch of funk to it.  Flavor is mild with a touch of fruit and funk and is quite chalky and thick.  A hint of funk but more dough than anything else in the flavor.

11.5 oz bottle from tytoanderso, thanks Tyler. Pours a slightly hazy orange marmalade colored body with a super large bubbly soapy white head. Aroma is excellent with lots going on...yeast, ripe bananas, green apples, tropical fruit, mint, slight bubble gum and grains. Body is thinner then I expected with light to average carbonation and a slightyl astringent finish. Flavor of lots of yeast, hoppy citrus, tropical fruits. Very nice but i expect nothing less from one of the best brew pubs in the world. Man I love DDC!!!!

Bottle: Pours a slightly hazy effervescent with a think pillowy white head. The aroma is somewhat phenolic with herbal notes- some honeysuckle, flowery suggestions, sweet and spicy Belgian yeast character, a spice note of thyme, and sun-dried tomato? Interesting. Pours bright gold into an English pint.  Fluffy off-white whipped cream head tophats as it slowly recedes leaving spotted sheets. Candi and malt aromas.  Smooth, creamy and slick with sour caramel and a dry, lasting citrus pip and pepper finish.

12oz bottle courtesy of glouglouburp.  Pours amber with a generous white head.  Smells grassy and dry with a funky undertone.  Tastes dry and lightly tarte with a grassy presence and some light peppery hints.

This is how it’s done! Honey colored with a huge white head. Light peach, fresh cut flowers, and a touch of pine in the aroma. The flavor is light, sweet, and a bit fruity at the start before coming on strong at the end with a notable hop bite. Easy to drink, subtle, and still complex.

Bottle. Pours with a largish, rocky, white head that leaves great, very strong lacing. Body is a murky yellow. Aroma of oranges, fruits, dryness, candi sugar, and honey. Taste is a bit bland, dry and spicy with a bit of hops. Very lively carbonated with a dry mouthfeel.

Pours a hazy honey yellow with thick white head. Aroma is floral with undertones of piney hops. Flavor is VERY floral with hops presence. Subtle floral notes such as lavender and rose. Light sugars but the sugars are covered by hops. Body is creamy with high carbonation.
A dry, herbal Belgian ale.  Wild grass, light malt, citrus, and wheat flavors.  Fairly complex.  Moderate hops in there as well.  This is really for a style that rarely produces exciting beers.

Gold with a thick white head.  Aroma is a light spice with yeast and citrus, light hoppiness, nice easy maltiness.  Taste is initially, citrus, light alcohol, and spice.  Pretty nice easy drinking belgian style ale.

Bottle.  Pours gold with a big white head and lacing.  Aroma of typical belgian gold, with yeast, light fruit, and spice.  Taste is also of fruit, spice, and yeast.  Finish is dry, almost champaign like, and bitter.  Mouth is light and easy-drinking.  Not a bad drinker.
(Bottle).  Fruity and earthy aroma.  Very cloudy orange-amber color, with large off-white head.  Flavor is apricot, pear, tangy, and spicy, quite unique.  Rather strange finish.  Interesting.

12 oz. bottle.  Light gold color with a huge, fluffy white head.  A good bit of lacing throughout.  Nice floral aroma with yeasty hints.  Flavor is a bit spicy, with subtle hints of honey and hops.  Finish is dry and bitter.  Very tasty beer.

Pours a light orange with a frothy off-white head. The aroma is rather faint, with hints of yeast, fruit and pineapple. This beer has a thick body and an explosive flavor, with notes of honey, lemon\citrus, yeast, caramel and some peach. Overall. I thought it was good, but seemed to have a little too much carbination.

Slightly hazed and tawny in color with a tall lingering frothy head. Superb lacing. Aromas  of citrus and stonefruit nectar. Medium weight on the palate with excellent carbonation creating an expansion on the palate with a fluffy softness. Dry yet fruity with flavors of citrus and banana gum spice.   A strict peachpit bittering component rips through every sip like a sword leaving a bitterness on the tongue. The finish is perfect. This beer is rich yet balanced.

Bottle - Volo. Appearance: Cloudy yellow, large white head, some teeny floaties. Aroma: nice grapefruit & yeast aroma with some black pepper too. Flavour - wow - a very big flavour, alcohol, spice with a dry yet somehow juicy finish! Lovely, very nice.

Pours a cloudy pale gold in color with about an inch or more of pillowy white head.  Smell is slight citrus and lemon zest.  There is a bit of yeast in there as well.  Just noticed some yeasties as I set down my beer as well.  There is quite a bit of hops and biting citrus in the taste.  Pretty hoppy belgian.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2009 Bottle, Volo. Hazy golden, off-white foam head. Citrusy, soft, sublime aroma. Crushing complexity. Citrus pith bliss. Sensual smoothness. The best of all worlds in this brew! 9-4-9-4-17 Bottle at home. Totally cloudy golden with bone-colored head. Sweet malt with nice bright hops, some vanilla, and leafy herbs and jasmine. High but soft carbonation. Nice and herbal with a great grassy and leafy character. More like a saison but nice for whatever it may be. Is a subtle beer, and I like it. 7-3-8-3-14

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2010 This is pretty well carbonated as a regular pour into my 25cl tulip glass produces a four finger thick, pale, off-white colored head.  The head is quite fluffy and creates ample lacing and a nice rocky surface as it slowly recedes.  The beer is an amber tinged gold color, but shows a lightly hazy, orange-gold hue when held up to the light.  The aroma, noticeable as I visually inspect this beer, smells of grassy hops.  A closer inspection yields aromas of orange zest, ginger, piquant white pepper and an herbal grassy note.  As I begin to notice the hops a bit more some aromas of tropical fruit (lychee, apricot) become more noticeable and compete equally with the herbal and grassy notes.  Towards the finish grassy grain notes, dusty crushed pale malt aromas and some crushed cracker notes become noticeable.  I really like the combination of vibrant hop aromatics and spicy yeast character and this beer definitely achieves that nicely.

Lightly sweet grain character mixes with the hops to produce some aromatic honey-like flavors.  The hop character at first contributes flavors of lychee, apricot and orange zest, but then towards the middle and into the finish picks up some herbal notes of lemon verbena, pine and a light, green grassy note, all the while retaining a lingering hop fruitiness.  The bitterness, for all of the hop character is fairly light; in fact there is more astringent, fresh green hop character in the finish than there is clean, biting bitterness.  This has a certain heft to it that is lightly viscous and of a light medium body; this still manages to be quite a bit more quaffable than the body might suggest (perhaps the hop character makes this more drinkable).  Fermentation character, while secondary to the hop character, still plays a significant role with flavors of clove, musty crushed pale malt, piquant-slightly-woody pepper, young ginger (accented by the hops) and some sharp phenolics that are more than clove but not quite into the cured plastic category.

My second pour sees an increase in a clean bitterness that is quite ample and seems accentuated by the zippy carbonation.  This is quite a tasty beer and I am really wishing this was a 750ml bottle that I was enjoying.  I definitely wish I had more of this beer as I am definitely a sucker for beers like this.

Purchased: Liquor Max, Loveland CO
UPDATED: DEC 11, 2008 bottle taken from le depanneur de la rive. Dark golden color with pretty large white head. pretty hoppy and overall a really nice ale.

Just not big on this one.  Aroma is extremely yeasty...with spice, hoppy presence, and a touch of citrus.  Flavor is peppery, with citrus and freshly baked bread evident.  Don’t think this beer knows what it wants to be when it grows up.
Bottle.  Hazy, dark golden pour.  Herbal hop aroma with some spice.  Flavor of herbal hop, some belgian yeast, spice.

341 ml bottle, courtesy of my brother - exploded out of the bottle and pours a cloudy creamed honey yellow with a large bone coloured head.  Amazing aroma - hugely hoppy, but with a real Belgian presence - peach, apricot, pear, a bit of booze - god, this is nice.  Very full in the mouth, and the carbonation level is excellent.  More fruits in the flavour, but darker than in the nose - plum, prune, a hint of anise.  A truly beautiful beer - Dieu du Ciel! continues to impress.

12 oz bottle. Pours hazy light gold with very large, sticky, off-white head. The aroma is spicy, with some ripe mango, lemon zest, sweet bread, and coriander. The flavor starts off on a peppery note, then comes that mango again, with some strong, earthy spice. The finish is zesty with some yeasty and peppery notes that linger for a while. Pretty tasty beer.

Cloudy golden body with a massive, rocky white head.

Tropical fruit yeast character with a fair amount of spice in the nose.  Peppery.

Pepper, tropical fruit, honey with a nice play between the sweet malt and the herbal and spicy notes.  

Carbonation is quite lively to the benefit of this beer.  Light on the tongue.  Finishes relatively dry.

Highly recommended.  One of the most enjoyable of the style I’ve had.

12oz bottle, courtesy of ryan.  Thanks!  Pours a slightly hazy, golden color; bright white head with solid retention and fine-bubbled lacing.  Solid amounts of honey, white pepper, and ginger in the aroma; nicely dry and peppery.  Lively carbonation.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: lots of white pepper, honey, and vanilla upfront; very lively mouthfeel; touches of alcohol at the perimeter, but very slight; overall, very drinkable, lively, and slightly sweet.  Lengthy finish: honey, white pepper, and toasted malts; reasonably dry and toasty throughout.

Hazy pale body with a small white head. Big floral and herbal hop nose with light honey and dough. The flavor is just lightly sweet and moderately bitter with spicy herbal and floral hops, light cotton candy, hay and honey. Medium body is round with moderate carbonation. Finish is long with a lasting bitterness.

12 oz. into pint; purchased at Discount Liquor.  Pours with a huge fluffy LaChouffe-esque head, dissipates rockily.  Smells yeasty, banana, some cardamom.  Foamy feel, carbonation is just soft as all get-out (what does that phrase mean, anyway?).  Some sticky lacing.  Flavor is underwhelming, but unoffensive:  some apricot in the beginning and finish, surrounded by pepper, tiny amount of banana, and maybe fruitcake.  The finish is nicely dry, and the pepper comes out more.  Still, kind of unimpressive.  Not hard to drink, but not memorable at all.

nice beer, bottle Cafe Volo. cloudy orange color, with little chunks at the bottom, nose was hopy but also , slightly soapy, with some nice belgian spices, flowers as well.flavor is yeasty but sweet, but well balanced peaches , and honey. some hops on the finish and a great Belgian ale is what we have, probably one of the best Belgian style ales in North America

Bottle. Sweet aroma of malt, wheat and sugar. Cloudy golden colour with a frothy, lively white head. Thick syrupy texture at first. Bitter, tangy with a little spice. Hint of floral notes. Bitter finish. Quality ale and very tasty.
bottle, cloudy orange color, large foam head, nose is sweet fruit, peppery with a dry fruity light finish

Bottle from The Keg Liquors. Nice suprise from what is quickly becoming one of my favorite breweries. Pour a cloudy orangey blonde. Aroma jumps out of the glass, presumably from the dry-hopping. Very lively palate (bottle conditioned?). Nice wild spice. Gorgeous fluffy head that lingers...and lingers...and lingers. Great beer.

Pours a bright, hazy yellow orange with a rocky white head that shows very good retention and sporadic lacing.  The aroma starts much like a typical Belgian pale with yeast and sweet fruits, but there is a big pepper presence that stings the nostrils a bit.  The taste has an even bigger peppery spice presence on top of the fruity hops up front and the yeast in the background.  There is also a bit of bananas in the taste as well.  The mouthfeel is pretty dry and peppery for the style with a bit less sweetness than I would expect.  This is another unique offering from Dieu Du Ciel and one that has a strong spice presence to mix it up a bit.  Very good.

12 oz bottle. Poured hazy yellow in color wtih a large white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, spices, and some esters. Tastes of fruity esters, bananas, citrus fruits, bread, pepper and other spices.  This one was quite refreshing and nice. I enjoyed the hop character.

Soft, fluffy white head with good lacing.
Cloudy gold color.  Smells of citrus hops and plastic.  Flavor is spicy Belgian yeast and bread plus banana and cloves like a wheat beer.  Nice hoppiness too.  A well-balanced, enjoyable beer.  Very drinkable.
Bottle from Coopers. cloudy yellow pour with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is of sppices and some banana. Taste has some nice sweet malt with some lemon and frut hanging around. Very good.

[1416-20080530] Tap. Mild Palmolive dish soap aroma has a bit of fruitiness and later is a bit of cooked egg. Hazy, light orange yellow body with a medium-lasting creamy white head and thick lacing. Booooozy medium yeast flavour has some citrus wheat. Medium body. Good.
(@ Dieu du Ciel!; Montreal, QC)

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2008 Bottle from secret Santa (sprinkle). Pours a hazy yellow color with a huge clumpy white head. The aroma is spicy and soapy with some banana bread. The flavor is well balanced with a host of complex tastes coming together nicely; I get citrus, grassy hops, biscuit, white pepper, pear and walnuts. The mouthfeel is malty and quite satisfying. The finish is long with lingering peaches and pears. Overall:  I am really quite surprised by this elegant concoction. Highly Recommended.  Thanks again mike.

Slightly haze with a light golden color.  Very aromatic - floral and spicy (peppery!).  Some sweetness and fruit as well.  Very bitter dry flavor with lots of spice and some malt.  Earthy and fruity.  Crisp and refreshing.  Reminds me of a nice wheaty summer beer, but a bit heavier and spicier.

11.5oz bottle. Pours deep yellow gold - cloudy with a medium-sized, fluffy, white head that quickly dissipates into a very thin, spotted, persistent ring of foam. The aroma is very Belgian: grassy hops, bready/doughy malt aroma, sweet and fruity esters, some bitter citrus elements (lemon zest, grapefruit rind), and some spiciness (pepper and coriander). The flavor starts very dry with a nice, big hop flavor and bitterness combined with subtle citrus - and an almost tartness. The beer remains dry and complexly bitter and earthy throughout. There is a subtle fruit ester note at mid-palate and some dry, toasted bread notes - but the malts are a bit subdued and there is almost no residual sweetness. Mid-tongue is bitter with earthy hops and an interesting but somewhat mild yeastiness - doughy and spicy. The finish is very dry and gives a subtle nod to a dry champagne. Another nod to champagne is the elegant and vigorous level of carbonation. The mouthfeel is very crisp with bubbles and the body is light (though swirling it in the mouth to release the CO2 reveals a slightly thicker and more slippery texture that is medium in body). Though the beer is very dry with a firm bitterness, the aftertaste reveals a nice graininess that tastes like pale malts with an ever-so-slight sweetness. Overall, a very interesting beer that is well constructed and very well suited for the warm weather.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2008 Bottle in trade from BlackForestCO.  Thanks!
Pours a nice yellowish gold with big lasting soapy white head.  Smell is lemon, some peppery spice and belgian yeast.  Taste starts hoppy, lightly bittered, and clean with orange peel and lemon, and then finishes a bit yeasty and musty.  The hops give a nice citrusy quality that brightens the belgian yeasty flavor Im not typically crazy about, and makes this a pretty solid beer for me.  Nice and crisp and lively mouthfeel.  Very drinkable.
pretty opaque, golden brown. hoppy belgian aroma (how descriptive). thin but nice. dry but balanced.
Slightly cloudy golden pour with orange tint.  Mild creamy white head.  Nice citrus, yeast, bread, tartness of summer fruits.  Spice present but well used.  A very crisp beer.  Lovely.

11.5 oz bottle from Kingdom Liquors (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy caramel golden color with a massive white, foamy head and clearly visible floaties. Excellent retention and lacing. Aroma is spicy, orange peel, ripe citrus, grain, bready yeast as well. Flavor is malty sweetness, spice, pineapple, banana with slight hoppy notes toward the end. Medium body with a slight bitter finish. Nice Belgian-style ale.

341ml bottle, with thanks to Glouglouburp for this great bonus!  Pours a clear golden with a towering fluffy white head, excellent retention and lacing.  Aroma is nice and spicy, with some light citrus and summer fruits.  Flavor is spicy again, with more citrus and island fruit present than in the aroma.  Quite quaffable and tasty.  Thanks Dany!

Bottle. Surprisingly  bitter and overly bitter at that, but  enjoyable nonetheless. Hazy, yellow/golden body below a large, frothy and white head that lasts. the aroma is mostly orange, grapefruit and pineapple with notes of coriander. Hints of grain and dust with some banana and apples underneath it all. The flavor is moderately sweet and moderately bitter, but the bitterness dominates both of the initial flavor and the finish. You can taste fruit and spice. Medium body and a velvety texture. Plenty of carbonation. Nicely complex. Very nice.

11.5oz bottle: Cloudy yellow pour with a thick, mound forming, head.  The warm nose notes lots of fresh bread, flavorful honey, ripe banana and apples, funky and earthy yeast.  Expansive carbonation works with the creamy, yeasty body. Mild, grassy bitterness leads the charge in the body, followed by a rush of flavors that include more esthery apple and pears, toast, graham cracker and sweet vanilla.  Very good and very complex.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2008 Pours hazy golden with three fingers of pillowy white head. The aroma is floral, definite pineapple, nice peppery phenolics. Nice spicy flavour. Firm bitterness and copious English hop flavour keep it very crisp, while the Belgian yeast notes (pineapple, pepper) carry over strongly from the aroma. Some alcohol. Silky and light on the tongue. Slight acrid dry hop character, almost tobacco-y. A beer of delicate but exceptional balance - a Belgian blonde with the hopping of an English summer bitter. Not a style-maker; just a perfect bent beer.
brings a harsh flavor of malts and spices. takes it with smotth drink. still very good.

The aroma is fruity and yeasty with malt, coriander, hops and spice. The appearance is nice with a large foamy head and hazy gold color. The flavor is like the aroma. The palate is thin. This is a nice belgian style ale.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2008 Frothy white head on a cloudy unpasteurised yellow body. Had to swirl the bottle at the end to get the sediment into the glass. Big citrussy, floral, yeasty, hoppy aroma. Complex flavor of spicy coriander, citrus, yeast and very hoppy. Another great beer from Dieu Du Ciel. They are making some great craft beers.

11.5 oz bottle pours a hazy golden amber body. Medium offwhite head retains well and leaves lots of thin patches of lace on the snifter. Aroma is spicy pepper, yeast, grassy and floral hops, and some citrusy esters. Light medium body has a zingy carbonation and a distinct peppery bite. Taste is complex and mostly hop driven. A floral and peppery dryness dominates the faint banana and grapefruit hints. Solid malt backbone is biscuity, with only a subtle sweetness. Belgian yeast is prominent. This Canadian ale is very much in the Belgian style of hoppy ales. Nicely done.

Cloudy amber with a good foam on top. The aroma is surprisingly hoppy. There’s this huge grassy noble hop aroma that shocks the sinuses. Flowery aroma that reminds me of jonquils/daffodils. Good straw malt like a pilsner with sweetness added. This is actually an incredibly tasty beer.

Bottle.  Big fruity, floral, spicy nose, heavy yeast presence but just dynamite flavor.  Coriander, lemon zest, wheat, and again, floral spice.  Hazy lemon yellow pour with a dense white head.  
Crisp medium body, almost too carbonated, with loads of wheat and lemon/orange peel.  Very, very dry and spicy, slightly peppery with coriander and alcohol heat, along with some sort of exotic guarana/guava/mango fruit notes coming from either the yeast or the hops.  Peach and pear, too.  A good one, feels more like a tripel than was likely intended.

Taste is a bit on the peppery side but the dry hopping adds a nice accentuation to its bitterness along with tones of lemongrass, orange and a strong grapefruit character. Ive been throwing that grapefruit word with other reviews but now I really taste it. My wife would probably give this over a 4 is she was a member here. Bottle from NEPA case split club.

A hazy golden-orange beer with a small white head that leaves a very nice lacing. Aromas of pepper, yeast and malt. Flavor is spicy and fruity, with notes of corianders and citrus. Light-medium body with a dry and hoppy finish. Well-balanced.

Cloudy yellow orange color with a huge gushing white head which is kind of annoying at first while you let it settle down.  Spice and yeast in the aroma.  Flavor is cinnamon and clove up front that fades into a slightly malty and fruity drink. Slight chalky texture.  Some citrus flavors and a bit of a bitter, metallic hop finish. 341ml brown bottle from Goldorak. Pours golden, some haze. Creamy and fluffy white cap which refuses to die, leaves excellent lacing.
